loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 47 años, vive en su ciudad natal en compañía de sus 3 hijas en su propia casa. Hace 10 años tiene su restaurante en su misma casa, fue animada por sus hijos a realizar este negocio por sus habilidades culinarias y así inició su negocio que hoy es principal fuente de ingresos. Trabaja diariamente para preparar variedad de platos, una de sus hijas la apoya en la atención de su restaurante así optimiza el servicio ya que  muchos de sus clientes les agrada que sean atendidos inmediatamente. En la actualidad vende comida de manera regular, lo cual significa un  ingreso estable para su familia. “Me agrada cocinar  y me siento muy alegre de hacerlo” manifiesta Marina. Por ahora sus planes es continuar impulsando su negocio hacia nuevas mejoras. Es una de las socias mas antiguas del banco comunal que integra, ya que son 23 oportunidades de crédito de las cuales se siente muy orgullosa de permanecer durante este tiempo porque  tiene la satisfacción de crecer sostenidamente en su negocio por los prestamos que ha recibido y por lo espera seguir recibiendo. En esta oportunidad invertirá el dinero en la compra de  ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor y en acondicionar su local.
texts.en:
Marina, age 47, lives in her own house in her native city with her three daughters.  She has had a restaurant in her house for ten years.  She was motivated by her children to undertake this business because of her culinary talents.  That is how she started her business, which is now her main source of income.

She works every day preparing a variety of dishes.  One of her daughters helps her with the responsibilities of her restaurant.  That optimizes the service because many of her customers like to be waited on immediately.  She currently sells food regularly, which means a stable income for her family.

“It pleases me to cook, and I feel very happy doing it,” says Marina.  For now her plans are to continue driving her business towards new improvements.  She is one of the oldest members of her communal bank.  She has had 23 opportunities with loans.  

She feels very proud to have stayed during this time because she has the satisfaction of growing steadily in her business.  She has done this with the loans she has received and hopes to continue receiving.  She will use the money this time to buy non-perishable ingredients wholesale and to fix up her place.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Dionisia  es conviviente, tiene 5  hijos,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Quiere al niño” grupo  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Dionisia  trabaja desD. hace 10 años en un locutorio donD. ella brinda el servicio D. llamadas telefónicas, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que  a su esposo lo despidieron D. su trabajo, pero sus deseos D. superación D. Victoria  eran más  grandes que sus problemas y a su vez  trabaja  como asistente social para una iglesia, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos  económicos, que le ha permitido construir su casa, y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para remodelar su negocio. Sabemos que Dionisia   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.

LA SEÑORA QUE ESTA EN LA FOTO RECORTADA SE LLAMA YULY BEATRIZ.
texts.en:
Señora Dionisia has a common-law husband and five children. She currently belongs to the "Quiere al niño" communal bank maD. up of nine members that are engaged in various commercial endeavors. 

Dionisia has worked for ten years at a phone service center where she provides access to telephone service. She started the job when her husband was fired from his job. However, her dreams of attaining success were much greater than her problems and in time she began working as a social worker at a church. 

Thanks to her efforts and dedication she has been able improve her income which has allowed her to build a house, providing her family with a better quality of life. In order to continue growing she is requesting a new loan to remodel her business. We know that Dionisia will accomplish her goals with lots of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

The woman in the tiny photo is named Yuly Beatriz.

loans.use: to remodel her business.

loans.name: Nilda Rosa

texts.es: Nilda está satisfecha porque muy pronto recibirá su quinto crédito y el segundo credikiva y comprará  materiales como hilazas de algodón  para la elaboración de artesanías y nuevos diseños de sandalias que tiene solicitadas por sus clientes. Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo y por eso debe ejercer su mayor esfuerzo en conseguir nuevos clientes y más recursos financieros para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual agradece a sus financiadores el gran apoyo que le están prestando. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nilda ingrese al siguiente enlace:   http://kiva.org/lend/218803
texts.en: Nilda is satisfied because very soon she will receive her fifth loan, her second with Kiva.  With this she will purchase materials such as cotton yarns for making handicrafts and new designs for sandals that have been requested by her customers.  Her goal is to increase her working capital and therefore she must exert her best efforts to get new customers and more financial resources to achieve this.  This is why she is grateful to her lenders for the great support they are providing.  If you want to know the history of Nilda enter the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/218803

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cotton yarns for making handicrafts and new designs for sandals.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Tahuaco, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales vacunos y ovinos, también dice se dedica a la venta de tejidos.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro ovejas para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, comprará también lana de oveja para la fabricación de frazadas y  llicllas (mantas).  Su esposo le ayuda con el negocio y también es agricultor,  vende papas y habas en Yunguyo.
Su sueño es tener más ganados y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the San Juan de Tahuaco Communal Bank in the central village of Tahuaco, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has six children.  She does not have an education.

Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested the money in her business of selling animals, cows and sheep.  She also says that she sells knitwear.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.

She will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy four sheep to fatten for three months.  She will also buy sheeps’ wool to make blankets and shawls.  Her husband helps her with the business.  He is also a farmer.  He sells potatoes and beans in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to have more livestock so that she can improve her income.

She likes her communal bank’s meetings.

loans.use: to buy four sheep and to buy sheep's wool.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Rocio

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene 2 hijas . Su actividad es la venta de comesticos.

Comenzó hace 5 años, cuando se separo del esposo y le gusta esa actividad y a la vez podía cuidar a sus hija que eran pequeñas. Labora diariamente promocionando sus productos a amigas y conocidas. Ella vende perfumes, cremas y desodorante por medio de catálogos y pedidos que hace. Le dificulta la competencia y la delincuencia ya que tiene que salir a entregar sus pedidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para sus ventas del negocio. En un futuro desea sur directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old, single and has 2 daughters.  She lives in an urban area called "el Guasmo" in Guayaquil.  (The area was given its name for the tree species Guazuma Ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a working-class neighborhood that was formerly a ranch).  Elizabeth's business is cosmetics sales.

Elizabeth started her business 5 years ago when she separated from her husband.  She likes the business and the fact that it allowed her to care for her daughters, who were young at the time.  Elizabeth works everyday promoting her products to friends and acquaintances.  She sells perfumes, lotions and deodorants via catalog and orders that her customers make.  Her work is difficult because of the competition and crime, as she has to go out to deliver her orders.  With the help of the loan, Elizabeth wants to purchase more products for her business to sell.  In the future, she hopes to be a Yanbal Manager.  (Yanbal is an international catalog-based sales company).

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and display cases for her business.

loans.name: Miriam Genoveva

texts.es:
Miriam de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 26, 22 y 11 años que estudia en colegio particular. Se dedica a ala venta de confitería.

Comenzó su actividad desde pequeña vendía en productos en lo estadios pero ahora lo hace en su casa para cuidar a la mama. Tiene dos sobrinos que le ayuda a vender labora de 9H00 a 11H30 am y de 2H00 pm a 4H30pm.. vende confites sorbetes y varios cosas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas materiales para sus ventas como sorbetes, confites. En un futuro desea comprar maquinas para realizas sus trabajos y mejorar mas sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 46 years old.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo (which is named after the 'Guazuma ulmifolia' species of tree), in Guayaquil.  Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of working-class people.  It used to be a large estate.  Miriam is single and has three children aged 26, 22 and 11 who attend a private school.  Miriam's business is selling confectionery.

Miriam started her business when she was young, selling products in stadiums.  Now she makes her sales from her home, so that she can care for her mom.  She has two nephews who help her to make her sales.  She works from 9.00am to 11.30am and from 2.00pm to 4.30pm.  She sells candies, sherbets (sorbets) and other products.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more supplies for her sales such as sherbets and candies.  In the future, Miriam would like to buy machines to carry out her work and further improve her income.

loans.use: to buy candies and sherbets (sorbets)

loans.name: Jesus Pablo

texts.es:
Jesús de 34 años , vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposa se encarga de la tienda. Tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de su esposa que quiso abrir una tienda de víveres. Su esposa es la encargada de abrir la tienda diariamente le ayuda a su esposa junta con sus hija cuando no tiene que hacer obras ya que el es albañil. En su tienda vende productos como azúcar, arroz, aceite todo tipos de víveres. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere compra mas mercadería como arroz por quintales atún y aceites para surtir mas su negocio. En un futuro quiere terminar su vivienda para tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 34 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, an outlying urban area that originally had irregular terrain with hills, creeks, and lagoons. There are remnants of a deteriorating environment. His wife manages a store. They have two children who attend public schools.

Some time ago, his wife wanted to open a grocery store. She is in charge of opening the store every day. Jesús works as a bricklayer and helps out with the store when no construction jobs are available. His daughter also helps his wife with managing the business. The family sells products such as sugar, rice, oil, and all types of groceries. With the help of this loan, Jesús will buy more merchandise such as rice by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg), tuna, and oil to restock the business. In the future, he hopes to finish the construction of his home so that his family will have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tuna, and oil.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Tahuaco, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos (3 independientes).  Estudió educación primaria (incompleta).
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace catorce años.  Su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de chanchos y abarrotes, negocio que tenía hace algún tiempo.
Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir como: ternos para varones y damas, camisas, zapatos.
Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 2500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará trajes para niños como vestidos, ternos.  Nos cuenta que trabaja junto con su esposo e hija, la mercadería la compra de la ciudad de Lima y la vende en la ciudad de Tacna.
También cuenta que se dedica a la venta de productos de la región como papa, habas y occa.
Su sueño es comprar una combi para darla en alquiler y así generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es estar con las socias porque intercambia palabras y experiencias.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Communal Bank “San Juan de Tahuaco” which is located in the central village of Tuahuaco in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children (three of whom are independent). Maribel did not finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 14 years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to buy pigs and groceries. She has managed her business for a few years. Maribel currently buys and sells clothing such as outfits for men and women, shirts, and shoes.

With this new loan of 2500 PEN, she will used the increased capital for her business to buy children’s outfits such as dresses and suits. Maribel says that she works with her husband and daughter. She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima and then sells it in the city of Tacna.

Maribel also sells regional products such as potatoes, beans, and oca. Her dream is to buy a minibus that she can rent out in order to generate more income. What she likes about her Communal Bank is meeting with the other members to exchange words and experiences.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Lizbet

texts.es: Lizbet de 24 años de edad, convive con Félix de 26 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos, Katherine de 7 años y Gabriel de 4 años, con quienes vive en su casa propia de la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Ella nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y a la vez poner semillas de cacao, desde entonces apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao. Es así que esta actividad lo realiza en su chacra introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo, con el apoyo de su querido esposo, pero a la vez cuenta con el apoyo de peones en tiempo de cosecha. Actualmente este producto tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello, que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en Centros de Acopio de su localidad. En adelante ella piensa comprarse más terrenos, para así, competir de manera equitativa con sus vecinos. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP. Por el que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles comprará un nuevo terreno para instalar más plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Lizbet is 24 years old and in a common-law marriage with Félix, age 26. They have two children, Katherine (age 7) and Gabriel (age 4). They live together in their own home in the community of Puerto Mayo in the District of Pichari. Lizbet will never forget the afternoons of her youth when she watched her grandparents plow their land and plant cacao seedlings. From that point, she wanted to become a farmer and grow her own cacao. To pursue this business, she learned new farming techniques. Lizbet has the help of her beloved husband, but she also hires workers during the harvest season. At the moment, there is plenty of demand for her product on a national and international level. This explains why she is pleased with the earnings she generates from the sale of her product at the local collection centers.

Going forward, Lizbet plans to buy more land so that she can compete on an equal level with her neighbors. This will be her third loan with MFP and she promises to be prompt with her payments. Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy another plot of land so that she can plant more cacao.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for planting cacao.

loans.name: Andres Tovar

texts.es: Andrés desde muy niño acompañaba a su madre a la plaza del mercado donde ella vendía arroz de cerdo y de lisa (plato típico de Barranquilla), negocio que tenía hace más de  treinta años y con con su utilidad, habia brindado bienestar a sus tres hijos como madre cabeza de familia; al llegar a la adolescencia Andrés se habia dedicado al estudio pero como  ya tenía conocimiento del negocio, y su madre falleció, dejandolo a cargo del negocio  y al cuidado de sus 2 hermanas menores, con quienes en la actualidad  convive en el municipio de Malambo, tuvo que asumir esta responsabilidad.   Andrés tambien consiguió trabajo como auxiliar de ventas en un depósito  de víveres en Barranquillita sector popular de la ciudad de Barranquilla,donde tiene su negocio, se encuentra contento con él y cuenta con la colaboración de su tía en el puesto de venta.  Su sueño es continuar fortaleciendolo porque y desea  brindarle  a sus hermanas una educación técnica para que puedan defenderse en la vida.   Su principal desafío fue ganarse la confianza de proveedores y clientes, quienes pensaron que en su corta edad, no iba hacer capaz de continuar con el legado de su madre. En la actualidad en su negocio  vende arroz de cerdo, y picadas de patacón con chicharrón de pollo, cuenta con dos personas que le venden en carretillas parte del arroz que comercializa; las ventas de su negocio son representativas porque el producto que ofrece es de consumo masivo, especialmente entre los comerciantes de los distintos mercados públicos del sector y los transeúntes que visitan la zona del mercado. Los gastos de operación son relativamente bajos, los  familiares son compensados con los otros ingresos que Andrés recibe. Su capital de trabajo está representado por la venta diarias en el negocio;  el ciclo operacional de este negocio  al igual que la rotación de su inventario es de un día,  debido a  que el producto que vende es de consumo inmediato, sus compras las realiza diariamente por lo que no maneja mucho inventario, la rentabilidad del negocio es aceptable supera el 10% y como Andres quiere  ampliar su mercado teniendo una mayor cobertura sectorial, cuenta con el personal idóneo para hacerlo y con la colaboración de su tia en el puesto de venta  , está solicitando su primer credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará en mayor volumen insumos que le representan un descuento especial, por hacer compras de contado y en mayor volumen.
texts.en: Since Andrés was very young, he would accompany his mother to the market square where she sold pork and rice and fish and rice (a traditional dish of Barranquilla). She had the business for more than thirty years and with her earnings was able to offer wellbeing to her three children as a mother. When Andrés became a teenager he went to school but since he already knew the business, when his mother passed away he took over the business and the care of his two younger siblings.  He lives with them now in the town of Malambo, since he had to take over this responsibility. Andrés also got a job as an assistant salesman at a grocery store in Barranquillita, a popular neighborhood of Barranquilla where he has his business. He is happy with and with his aunt's cooperation in the his sales stall. His dream is to keep getting stronger because he wants to offer his sisters a technical education so they can get ahead in life. His biggest challenge is gaining the trust of suppliers and customers, who think that because of his young age he wasn't going to be able to carry on his mother's legacy. At present, in his business, he sells  pork rice, and fried plantains with chicken. He has two people selling rice from carts. The product he offers is of mass consumption, especially with the merchants from the public markets in the area and the passerby in the market. The operating expenses are relatively low, and family members are compensated with the other income that Andrés receives. His working capital is made up of the business' daily sales. The operational cycle as well as the inventory rotation is one day long, since his product is is for immediate consumption. He does his buying every day so he doesn't carry a lot of inventory. The business' profits are acceptable, over 10%. Andres wants to increase his market and have wider coverage and he has the ideal personnel to do it with the cooperation of his aunt. He is asking for his first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy ingredients in greater quantities which will mean a special discount, because he will be paying upfront and for larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, meat and flour.

loans.name: Jerus

texts.en:
Jerus, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and rice by the kilogram.

In business for 12 years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods. A member of HSPFI since 2003, Jerus hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sacks of rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia  is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.  Lucia  has a shop that sells snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to resell. Lucia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lucia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Joe Carlo

texts.en: Joe Carlo is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.   Joe Carlo has a shop that sells cell phone accessories, toys & school supplies. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy additional stocks of toys & cell phone accessories.  Joe Carlo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy toys & cell phone accesories

loans.name: Nora Mercedes

texts.es: Nora de 53 Años, es una mujer muy emprendedora que vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolívar  y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de  33-26-22 y 19 años,  los dos últimos dedicados al estudio y  los otros dos son independientes y trabajan. Nora en su pueblo  vende comidas   especiales para eventos, ensaladas frías, rollos de carne, perniles, pechuga en rollo y también los fines de semana prepara deliciosos patacones rellenos para la venta. Ella inició este negocio  porque tiene un especial gusto por la  cocina y por eso aprendió viendo a sus hermanas, leyendo  libros, atendiendo los programas de culinaria  en la televisión y con un amigo trabajador de un Hotel.  El sueño de Nora es tener un restaurante con una infraestructura confortable y apoyar a sus hijos para que logren estudios profesionales, y ella poco a poco está trabajando en este propósito, como cada día crece su clientela su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para extenderse por eso está recurriendo a un credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  carnes frías, mayonesa, mostaza, panes, maíz, verduras, perniles, un asador. Esta inversión tendrá éxito, porque cuenta entre sus clientes con   un equipo de  profesores, trabajadores independientes amas de casa,  que solicitan comidas en diferentes eventos sociales y recreativos y porque ella produce ingresos todos los fines de semanas en su punto de venta de patacones rellenos que es bien conocido. Su mayor desafío  lo tuvo  cuando se desplazó de San Juan a Cartagena por culpa de la violencia hace 12 años, pero eso es cosa del pasado y ella pudo retornar y retomar sus sueños. Mientras construye sus sueños se esfuerza en su trabajo generando  una rentabilidad sobre ventas no menor del  37.74%
texts.en: Nora is 53 years old. She is an enterprising woman who lives in the town of San Jacinto, departament of Bolívar. She has 4 children, aged  33, 26, 22 and 19. The two youngest are on their own and work. Nora sells special food for events in her town, such as salads, meat rolls, pork, and rolled chicken breast.  On weekends, she also makes stuffed plantains to sell. She started this business because she really likes cooking and she learned watching her sisters, reading books and watching cooking shows on television as well as with a friend who works at a hotel. Nora's dream is to have a restaurant with comfortable infrastructure and to support her children so that they can learn a profession.  She is working on this little by little and since her clientele grows every day her working capital is insufficient. That is why she is turning to a Kiva loan. This is the first loan she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy cold cuts, mayonnaise, mustard, bread, corn, vegetables, pork, and a grill. This investment will be successful because among her customers are a group of teachers, independent workers, and housewives who ask for food for different social  and recreational events. She produces income every weekend at her stuffed plantain sales spot, which is well known. Her biggest challenge was when she moved from  San Juan to Cartagena because of the violence 12 years ago. But that is in the past and she was able to return and return to her dreams. While she is making her dreams come true she is working hard making profits of no less than 37.74%

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, mayonnaise, mustard, bread, corn, vegetables, pork and a grill.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.   Maria Fe has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Maria Fe has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods to resell.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda  is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Elda  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & breads. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to resell.

Elda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 14 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & detergents to resell.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

Joe-ann requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to buy building materials too expand her food stall.

Joe-ann has been member of GDMPC for more than 10 years. In the future, Joe-ann hopes to expand her business and gain more profits.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 45 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of four school-aged children. Marlon own a small convenience store in his town. He sells groceries, feed, medicine, and mobile loads and refills gas tanks. He has been running his business for six years with a monthly income of PHP 5,000. He requested a loan of PHP 50,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell. Marlon had been a member of GDMPC for more than eight years. In the future, Marlon hopes to have more convenience stores in the city.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Marisa

Marisa has a small market at home. She sells assorted food products, rice, corn, refreshments and feed. Marisa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. She earns a total average monthly income of PHP 3,000 in this business. Marisa requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase feed to sell. Marisa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 62 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a widow and a father of four adult-aged children. Alfredo is a farmer. He owns and operates business planting and harvesting corn to earn a living. He chose corn to be planted in his field because it can be used as food and as raw materials for the manufacture of fuel, alcohol and essential chemicals. He has run this type of business for more than 10 years with a monthly income of PHP 6,670. He requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase a good variety of corn seeds to be planted in this coming planting season.

Alfredo has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Alfredo hopes to buy a hectare of land to expand his corn production.

loans.use: To purchase a good variety of corn seeds

Bernardita has a mini-grocery store at home. She sells canned goods, food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachet, candies and chocolates. She also makes freshly prepared snacks to sell like banana cue and pancake. She established her business 10 years ago to generate a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell. Bernardita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Bernardita hopes to purchase more stock and allow customers a greater choice.

She sells good viand, tasty desserts and refreshments in her food stall to earn a living. Juliana has been running this food business for six years. She earns PHP 15,000 per month. Juliana requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase kitchen utensils to be used in food preparation. Juliana has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Juliana hopes to have her own restaurant that generates excessive profit.

Hoa operates a food stall selling tofu. She has been involved in this business for 1 year.   She is applying for a loan to purchase raw materials for her tofu stall.

In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, she hopes to maintain a successful business and to build a new house.

Irenea has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have a piggery and to make her one child who is in school finish studies.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is 20 years old and attends college.

loans.use: buy construction material

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 32-year-old business woman.  She is married and has 3 children. In 2008, this borrower established a shop seling provisions, rice and toiletries. She began her business to keep herself busy, though her husband did not want her to engage in any form of business or work. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy rice, provisions and toiletries. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, she plans to give her children the best in life. High inflation rates and transportation costs are her major business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, provisions and toiletries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Elizabeth sells different kind of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and anything that is needed in a household.  She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 9000 from this work. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 30000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: buy products for her general store

loans.name: Gloria Estefany

texts.es: Gloria es una joven de 20 años muy dinámica y emprendedora que se dedica a la actividad comercial, vendiendo artesanias y otras mercanicas que trae de Sn Pues un Municipio del departamento de Sucre, y distribuye entre sus clientes, entre los que se cuentan vecinos, famliares, amigos, empleados, trabajadores independientes de los barrios Los Almendros, El campito, La Alboraya El santuario en Barranquilla y recientemente abrio una plaza en el municipio de Galapa a 15 minutos de la ciudad mencionada. En el negocio trabaja con su madre a quien le debe mucho de su experincia y tambien su novio.  Gloria vende sus productos a crédito en mayor volumen y con abonos semanales y quincenales, aunque en algunas plazas cobra diariamente. En la actualidad parte de sus compras la hace a proveedores de contado y alguna de ellas a créditos. El desplazamiento al municipio de Sanpues lo realiza en transporte público, viajando dos veces por mes.  El negocio de Gloria presenta buenos indices de liquidez,  rotaciòn de sus cuentas por cobrar cada 18 días y muy rápidamente sus inventarios. Asi mismo presenta niveles de rentabilidad que demuestran la eficiencia  y solvencia del negocio para compromisos futuros y su mayor desafio es la distancia que tiene que recorrer para acceder a los productos que requiere y tambien los costos del mismo que no se mantienen estables. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà candelabros, lámparas manufacturadas, esquineras y mecedores, para complacer a sus principales clientes que le han solicitado estos productos.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 20, is a dynamic and enterprising young woman who works in the retail sector. She sells handicrafts and other types of merchandise that are brought in from Sampués, a town in the Department of Sucre. Gloria distributes her goods to her customers who include neighbors, relatives, friends, employees, and independent workers in the neighborhoods of Los Almendros, El Campito, La Alboraya, and El Santuario in Barranquilla. She recently opened a shop in the town plaza of Galapa, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. Gloria manages her business with her mother, who has plenty of experience, and her boyfriend. She sells her products on credit and in large volumes and then collects payment either weekly or every 15 days. In some places, she collects payment on a daily basis. At the moment, she must pay cash for the merchandise she acquires from her distributors, but there are some who will extend credit to her. Gloria’s trips to the town of Sampués occur twice per month and she utilizes public transportation. Her business shows good indication of its liquidity. Her accounts receivable period averages 18 days and the product turnover within her inventory moves very rapidly. In addition, her profitability levels indicate that her business is efficient and solvent enough to cover her future commitments. However, her greatest challenge is taking into account the distance she must travel to acquire her products. Gloria must also consider her travel costs since those factors are not stable.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy chandeliers, manufactured lamps, cupboards, and rocking chairs so that she can satisfy her main customers who have requested these products.

loans.use: to purchase chandeliers, manufactured lamps, cupboards, and rocking chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 32-year-old business man.  He is single and has no children. In 2001, this borrower opened his tailoring business. He started out as an apprentice and now is well-established and is sewing for important people. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy a new sewing machine. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000 . 

In the future, he plans to open up a fashion shop. The borrower's business has many competitors, but due to his excellent sewing, customers always request his services. He is a very hardworking youth. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged 6, 10 and 18. In 2006, he established a pharmacy. He began this business immediately after he left secondary school, which he did because he did not have financial support to continue his schooling.  At that point in his life,  he became involved in business with the aim of generating enough income to continue his schooling.  Unfortunately, he did not continue.  He therefore decided to make business his career and thanks to God, he has achieved greatly in business.  He has been able to build a house, where he presently lives, and can now take good care of his home.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business.  He serves the Makama community, where he sees over 30 customers each day.  His business is popular because he is the only person selling pharmaceutical products in his area.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to purchase more pharmaceutical products -- ampicilin (100 cartons @ 120,000), pinoplex (5 cartons @ Le180,000), etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, he plans to take this loan, which will help him greatly as additional capital, and realize more profit so that he can give a quality education to his children and take good care of his wife.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy pharmaceutical drugs in bulk

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:

Her husband is involved in the agriculture business. He is a farmer. He works in fields growing different seasonal crops. He has good business contacts in his region. He is very expert in his work because he has a family background of agriculture. He has been doing this for many years and it gives him good earnings every month which allows him to provide the basic necessities to his family. 

Nadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to be able to get good result from his field and earn a good profit. 

Nadia is hopeful that her husband's business will be expanded after the loan investment and he will be able to raise the family’s living standard as a result.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 43 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged 8, 12, 15 – two are students.  

In 2001, he established his tailoring materials business. He gained tailoring experience from his uncle, who brought him up.  He was selling for his uncle until he became mature and could stand on his own.  With a small amount of starting capital, he has been able to establish his business to this level.  His business is so special to him because from it he has been able to acquire two town lots, on which he is planning to build a house very soon. He also uses his profits to educate his children and take good care of his home.

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. This borrower has successfully repaid 2 previous loans, and now requires a new loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to pay for assorted materials, such as:   3 bales of poplin @ Le 429,000,  100 bales of lace @ Le 140,000, 10 bales of stickers @ Le 120,000, 5 cartons of thread @ Le 230,000, etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, he plans to open another outlet and employ one of his brothers there.  He hopes to start constructing his house after realizing the profit from this loan and moreover, give a quality education to his children in the future when he has become old.  Weather conditions affect his sales, especially  the rains.  The competition is minimal as he is different from competitor because he provides his customers what they want.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 30 years old and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Emerlyn is in the agricultural business farming coconuts in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan for PHP 29500 through NWTF to pay for laborer  salaries and purchase more coconuts from her neighbors to sell in bulk.

Emerlyn has been farming coconuts for 8 years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activities.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: pay for labor and buy coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 37-year-old borrower.  He is married and has 3 children aged 3, 6 and 9. In 2000, he established a business selling metal frame windows, doors, and gates. He began his business because it was the only means of employment for him to make his living.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy raw materials (assorted metals). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, he plans to open another workshop to train youths, help educate his children, and buy land.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy raw materials (iron rods)

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 48 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines.  She has been raising hogs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a carenderia (restaurant).

Geronima is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.   She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 31 years old. She is married, and has 3 children ages 6, 8 and 12 years old. In 1992, she established her provisions shop. She began her business because she inherited it from her parents. So when she got married, she started doing it for herself from the little money given to her by her husband. She now enjoys doing business because she almost solves all of her problems and is able to assist her husband in taking care of the home.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy 10 cartons @ 72,000 SLL, mayonaise - 10 cartons @ 190,000 SLL, sugar (cube) - 10 cartons @ 100,000 SLL and soft drinks - 10 crates @ 35,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. She is convinced that in acquiring this loan, her shop will expand more than before, and she even hopes to establish another outlet so that she can assign one of her brothers to be selling there. With a second outlet she could realize more profits and therefore help her husband greatly in taking care of the home. 

In the future, she hopes to acquire a piece of land and educate her children as well. Some of the profit has been put back into the business and some used to solve domestic problems. She has a plan to expand and continue accessing loans from Kiva partner Association for Rural Development. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman with a good vision. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for assorted items and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for larger quantities of electrical items

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea is 40 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   Heraclea has been raising pigs for 7 years.  She also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Heraclea is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw materials to produce gara textiles

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 34 years old and lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four school-aged children. Marilyn has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service for one year. She runs this type of service because motorcycle transport is highly in demand by passengers because of its door-to-door service, availability, flexibility, speed and low price. Marilyn established the motorcycle transport to generate extra income of PHP 5,880 per month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase tires and accessories for her motorcycle. Marilyn is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Marilyn hopes to purchase additional motorcycles to transport passengers.

loans.use: to purchase tires and accessories.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old.  She is married and has 8 children.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.    She has been running her store for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Josephine has requested a loan for PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like milk, coffee, sugar, salt, creamer, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  Josephine has borrowed and repaid 23 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 45 years old. She is married and has 4 children ages 4, 6, 9 and 15 years old. In 1997, she established her provisions (milk, sardine, margarine, sugar etc.) business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and establish a savings account. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to add to capital to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, she plans to visit pilgrimage land (Mecca), continue to support her husband, and construct a house. Transportation and frequent increase in the cost of stocks are her biggest challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted provisions such as milk, sardine, margarine, sugar etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 10 and 18 years old. In 1986, she established her articles business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and establish a savings account. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to have working capital to buy clothing materials, batteries, and soap in larger quantities. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, she plans to build a house and promote her children's education. Her main challenges to her business are the cost of transportation, and new fashion and designs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing material, batteries, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 48 years old. She is married and has 5 children aged 7, 9, 12, 15 and 25. In 1980, she established her provisions business. She started her business because she wanted to generate income and establish savings. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. She now requires a new loan to buy more provisions by the carton and packet such as milk, sugar and sardines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, she plans to supply to retailers, educate her children and buy land. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for provisions, milk, sugar and sardines

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years year old.  He is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 10. In 1996, he established his second hand bags/shoes business. He started his business because he wanted to educate his children, maximize profits and establish savings. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. He now requires a new loan to pay for 5 bundles of used bags/shoes.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, he plans to expand his trade, educate his children to university level, buy land and open another stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bundles of bags and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 45 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 12. In 1991, she established her rice sales business. She started her business because she hopes to sustain herself and to help her husband. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month. 

She would like a loan of Le 3,500,000 to buy 200 bags of rice @ Le 145,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, she plans to supply to retailers and travel to Freetown to buy rice in greater quantities. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for 200  bags of rice

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an eatery business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling dried fish.  

Joy is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her eatery business.   She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her eatery business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 37 years old.  She is married and has 1 child aged 7. In 2004, she established her provisions business. She started her business because she wanted to promote her well-being in life. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy larger quantities of assorted food items in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to build a house and open another shop. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted provision items

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old.  She is married and has 5 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Julieta has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 16 years.  Julieta has requested a loan of PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional lumber and other materials for her furniture making business.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy lumber and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for assorted items by the carton or in bales

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children aged 8, 10, 14, and 18. In 1996, she established her rice business. She started her business because it would help her husband and her family and, also help to build a house on her land. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy rice - 80 bags @ Le160,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, she plans to supply to retailers and open another shop. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for 80 bags of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 57 years old. She is a widow and has 7 children aged 7, 9, 13, 16, 21, 25 and 27. In 1996, she established her used clothing business. She started her business because she wanted to provide a sustainable income for the family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. She now requires a new loan to buy used clothing - 4 bales of party dresses @ Le1,200,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to supply to retailers, build a house and open another shop. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal sales business. He buys young animals from the animal market and sells to the customers who require them, after raising them, at a good profit. His income becomes double on the Eid (Muslim holy day) because people buys animals for slaughter. At other times, he sells to butchers. 

With the loan, he will buy goats to be able to raise them and sell them for a good profit. He has been doing this business for many years and has got a good reputation among his clients for his good business sense and knowledge about animal breeds. 

Sardaran herself is a housewife but also supports her husband in taking care of his animals. She provides them timely food & water and keeps their stalls clean. She is hopeful that the loan investment will be a productive one for her husband. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for assorted provision items by cartons.

loans.name: Lilevier

texts.en:
Lilevier works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years.

Lilevier has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 30 years old, married, and has 1 child who is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   She has a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 4 years.

Ma. Fe has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy stocks to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married with 4 children. She is 44 years old and lives in Sindangan.
For 3 years, Luzminda has been selling a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 11,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 to purchase more products for her retail store.
Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Thara

texts.en:
Ma. Thara is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children -- 3 are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Thara buys and sells bananas in the Philippines and has been in this business for 4 years.   She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to provide security for her family.

loans.use: buy more bananas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 24 years old.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 4 and 10 years. In 2005, he established his business. He began his business because he needed a means of employment for the upkeep of his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to improve his working capital by adding stock in larger quantities.  He wishes to buy 10 cartons of batteries @ SLL 150,000; 20 boxes of cigarettes @ SLL 70,000 and 20 cartons of toilet soap @ SLL 55,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. In the future, he plans to open another shop, buy a bike as transport to meet customers, and educate his children well.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted items for stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for rubber buckets and sets of pans and bowls.

loans.name: Dalinda L

texts.en:
This is a 34-year-old businesswoman.  She is married and has 4 children aged 11, 9, 5 and 2. She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephew. 

In 2010, she established her provision business. She began her business on her own and is able to gain more income for her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL (~$280) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy additional fresh milk, sugar, sardines, batteries, and pampers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 (~$70). In the future, she plans to educate her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional provisions to sell.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She has been operating this business for many years. Her talent has become a source of earning to live a sustainable life. She does this work at her home.  

Her clientele base is her community ladies and also boutique owners. Her work has found good acknowledgement among her clients. She completes each dress in 3 to 4 days' time period. She crafts beautiful designs on cloth which attracts many clients to her and she receives regular orders. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to complete orders on time and earn maximum profits. She is hopeful that through the loan investment her business will grow further and also improve the financial condition of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 35-year-old businesswoman.  She is married, and has 4 children aged 16, 13, 10 and 7 years. In 2006, she established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wants to be independent and be able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL (~$163) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires this loan in order to buy more assorted plastic slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL (~$47). 

In the future, she plans to own a bigger shop, build a house and educate her children. The persistent increase in the prices of goods is her major business challenge.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years old.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 14,10 and 7 years. She has 4 additional dependents - her mother and three nephews of her husband.  In 2000, she established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she inherited it along with her business skill, and to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL (~$208) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL (~$70). 

In the future, she plans to own a bigger shop and build a house. She wants to become an international businesswoman. The persistent increase in the general price level is her major challenge.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye who sells bags, purses, wallets, backpacks, etc., in one of the local markets called “Krytyi” (“Covered”). She has been in this trade for 13 years. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory and her gross turnover amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. 

Galina started her small vending business selling hair combs, small cosmetics gifts, and manicure sets. However later, she decided to change the type of inventory she offers for sale and started selling purses and backpacks. She admits that she likes working with this merchandise because it sells well and is easily transported. Galina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to diversify her assorted merchandise.

loans.use: buy assorted merchandise

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very humble-natured lady. She always behaves well with everyone. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also manages her embroidery business efficiently. Her business returns show good profit which allows her to manage the household expenses. 

She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes which helps her in attracting many customers to her. Her clientele base is her community ladies who give her regular orders due to her neat and good work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and increase her profits. She is hopeful that her business will expand further and increase her income.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.en:
Gudelia is married with 4 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Binuangan, Sindangan. She sells cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP (~$100) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase more lipstick, perfume and other cosmetics. Gudelia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more lipstick, perfume and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.en:
Anastasiya is married and has a small son. She sells all kinds of souvenirs at an open market in Novaya Kahovka. Anastasiya started this business nine years ago because she needed to support her family. Today her business is doing well. Anastasiya enjoys selling souvenirs very much and would like to develop her business further. 

Anastasiya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of souvenirs to sell and attract more customers. Anastasiya is hoping to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy an assortment of souvenirs

loans.name: Jefrilus

texts.en:
Jefrilus is a 28-year-old single man. He lives with his mother and his sister since his beloved father passed away eight years ago. 

Jefrilus initiated a pig breeding business in 2008. He usually raises the pig for 7-8 months before selling it at around 2,500,000 IDR (~$300) per pig as long as the pig reaches the weight standard. With the income from his business, Jefrilus is able to support his mother in fulfilling their daily needs.

He is a hard worker. Even though he has a pig breeding business he also works as a guard in an elementary school near his residence and is a motorcycle-taxi driver as well. He is willing to do any work for his family and he also desires to save part of his income for his future.

Jefrilus has sold one pig recently, so currently he is fattening one pig. He desires to raise more pigs. He is sure that the more pigs he raises, then the more income he can earn. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He would like to purchase more piglets to be raised and fodder for them. He is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to be raised and fodder for them.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tandoor (a kind of stove made with mud, burning wood, used to make bread). His tandoor is located in the community and he gets good income on a regular basis.  He sells each flatbread for Pak rupees 5 which is almost the same everywhere. His bread quality is very good and he uses good quality flour for making bread.  

With the loan, he will buy flour and wood to be able to fill the customers’ orders on time and generate more income. 

Shamim herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities, staying at home. She is hopeful that the loan investment will prove a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy flour & wood for bread-making & selling business.

loans.name: Meny

texts.en:
Meny, a 36-year-old lady, is married to Benedictus, a 39-year-old taxi driver. They have four children. Noventio is 11 years old and in the first grade of senior high school. Jean is 9 years old and Troy is 8 years old and both are at the elementary school. The youngest, Febry, is 5 years old and not at school yet.

Meny sells cooked vegetables (cassava leaves, kangkung and beans), tofu and “tempe” (soybean cake). She also sells a kind of beverage called “es cendol” (consisting of ice, coconut milk, palm sugar and jelly). She operates her business in front of her house. 

Meny usually wakes up early in the morning to cook and to prepare the ingredients for “cendol” to be sold. Meny runs this business because she wants to help her husband in supporting their family since his income is unstable and dependent on how many customers hire the taxi.

Meny would like to sell more food such as meat, fish and snacks. Therefore, Meny is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to buy those foods to sell. She is expecting that TLM is willing to provide a loan for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more food such as meat, fish, chicken and other snacks

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She has been operating her business for many years. In her working years, she has never received any complaints from her clients about her work. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of her clients and earns better profits. Her clientele base is her community ladies who prefer giving her orders for her good work. She completes each dress in 3 to 4 days' time frame and earns well after completing one.  

She is hopeful that the loan investment will take her business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Sumera's Group

texts.en:
Sumera has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s rent-a-bike business. He has two bikes which he rents out to people and charges on an hourly basis. He has been in this business for the past 7 years and it is earning well for him. With the loan, he will buy another motorbike to start using it in his business to generate more income.  

He gives full attention to his business and also takes care of his motorbikes because he knows that if his assets work well than he can continue his work and can easily make more money. 

Sumera hopes that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sumera.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy plastic bottles in bulk quantity to be able to provide to different medical clinics and medicine sellers.  He has been operating this business for many years.  His buyers use the plastic bottles for filling with medicines like syrups etc.  
 
Najma herself is a housewife and manages her household work by staying at home. She gets up early in the morning, cleans the whole house and cooks food for her family. She enjoys doing household work and feels healthy by taking care of her family and fulfilling their needs.  

She hopes that the loan investment will bring her husband’s business to a more profitable position and increase his clientele base.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Siele

texts.en:
Siele is  25 years old.  He is married and has a 1-year-old child. He has been farming for 3 years, producing milk, eggs and poultry birds in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Siele has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has really improved his family's living standards and he wants to own more dairy cows to generate more income to pay for the education of his children in the future. He is also focusing on purchasing more land for better farming.

Siele mentions a lack of finances and animal diseases as the major challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s food-selling business. He specifically sells roasted chicken to his clients. His food item is very famous among people and they come from different places to taste his food. With the loan, he will buy chickens in bulk quantity to expand his business further and improve his clientele base.  

Rukhsana herself is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She and her husband are fond of cooking and experimenting with new food dishes. They both help each other on weekends and cook food for the family.  

Rukhsana hopes that the loan investment will be proved beneficial for her husband’s business and improves the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer and a teacher in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya, where he lives with his wife. He is 25 years old and has been in active farming for two years. He sells milk products at the local market.

Charles has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. 

Charles says that, in his business, cow diseases and fluctuations in prices and are the greatest challenges. However, he says dairy farming has recently improved his life and he wants to acquire an additional cow to make his production better. He believes the business will enable him to build a strong foundation for his young family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of and insurance for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is a talented lady who operates a beauty salon at her home where she provides beauty services to her community ladies at reasonable rates. She loves doing her work. She has experience in bridal makeup and haircuts. Her quality services attract many customers to her salon. The income she earns motivates her to work with more dedication.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will buy beauty products (creams, masks) and makeup items (mascara, eye-shadow, lipsticks, etc.) to use in her salon to give a presentable look to her customers and provide more comfortable and quality services. 

She is very hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and makeup items for beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik was born in 1952 in Yerevan. She is a widow and lives with her daughter, son-in-low and four grandchildren. 

For more than 35 years, Sofik has engaged in garment making. For more than 20 years she worked at the manufacturer Metax as a seamstress. Then she worked at Ayas, a knitted goods factory, as a weaver.

After the Soviet Union period, Sofik and her husband decided to run their own business, so at first they started to sew for customers in their house. As demand grew, they decided to organize a little workshop in front of their house. Sofik and her husband produced various clothes for different organizations and individuals. 

Five years ago, Sofik became a widow, and she could not cope with her business alone, so she asked her daughter’s family to move to her house and to help her with the business. 

Thanks to their joint effort, they are able to continue the business and to keep it in their family.
 
Sofik needs a loan of 1,200 US dollars to buy a new sewing machine and different patterns and materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and different patterns and materials for her business.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is 36 years old, married with six children. Her eldest son does a private job while the remaining five are getting an education from a local school. Her husband also does a private job with a monthly wage.  

Muniran herself is a talented lady. Besides her household work, she does sewing & embroidery work for her neighbors to help her husband financially.  She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes and sews with perfect measurement for her customers which makes them happy and allows them to give her regular orders. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing & embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy a sewing machine and embroidery material to be able to provide better services to her customers and increase her income. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Muniran.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine & embroidery material for sewing & embroidery business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old. She is married and has three children between 10 and 4 years old. Two of the children go to school. Her husband is a lawyer.

Rose sells clothes. She has been doing this business since 2007. From this business, she has been able to buy a piece of land. 

She needs a loan to increase her capital by buying more clothes. She plans to buy more clothes from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov lives in Vanadzor city. She is a widow and has two daughters who are already married and live separately from their mother. 

Nine years ago, Lyubov began to rent a women's clothing retail shop where she manages her own business. In her shop Lyubov retails skirts, trousers, blouses and outerwear. Her daughter's mother-in-law helps Lyubov in her business and replaces her once a month when Lyubov goes to purchase more merchandise.
