This is Lyubov’s second loan from Kiva and fourth from Nor Horizon. Now she is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of sundresses, summer chemises, etc., for her business.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of sundresses, summer chemises, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old and a hard-working business lady. She is married and a proud mother of four children age 17, 12, 7 and 2. She has been running a retail shop for the last year. Previously, she was a housewife.
 
In the next five years she wants her business to grow into a mini-supermarket and she hopes tht someday it will grow into a full fledged super market.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, this dream is becoming a reality as she receives finances for expansion and valuable managerial advice.

She wants 100,000 KES to expand her retail shop.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 35 years old. She has nine children from 6 to 23 years old. They are all in school. She is a widow. 

Chantal owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items such as sugar, matches, flour, rice, etc. She has done this business for five years and it’s going well. It has enabled her to meet the need of her family and pay her children’s school fees. 

She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more items to put in her store and make more profits. With the profits, she plans to save until she can afford to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more items for sale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 30 years old. She has three children who are 3 to 10 years old. They are all in school and her husband is a driver. 

Clementine sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling these clothes for the past 16 years. This business has enabled her to make some savings and pay school fees for their children. 

She needs a loan to buy a variety of clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 50 years old. He lives in Vanadzor with his mother, his wife and his daughter. 

For about four years, Armen has run his own business. He buys eggs and sweets from wholesale dealers and distributes the merchandise to food shops in Vanadzor and the whole Lori region. Armen uses his garage to store the items and he distributes them to food shops using his own truck, which he bought thanks to his business income. 

Armen’s wife helps him in his occupation and thus they are able to meet their family's needs.
 
Armen wants to diversify his merchandise, so he needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy large lot of various sweets for his business.      

This is Armen’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of various sweets for his business.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a 37-year-old business lady who has been selling shoes for seven years. She is a single mother of one child who is 15 years old. 

She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one in five years. Her dream is to own a piece of land, construct her own house and buy her own vehicle. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy more shoes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is a mother of two children who are ages four and six years old. Her husband is a civil servant. Consolee sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling clothes for the past eight years. Throughout these years, this business has enabled her to pay her children school fees and meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profits. With the profits she plans to save until she can afford to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 29 years old and she has a 10-year-old child. Her husband is a motorcyclist. 

Diane sells food stuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs such as green bananas for the past two years. This business has earned her enough income to buy her own motorcycle and meet the needs of her family. 

She needs a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to save until she can afford to build her own family house.

loans.use: to buy green bananas and other food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is 38 years old. He is from Vanadzor city, where he lives with his wife and his two young sons.

Hovhannes is an engineer, but for more than 10 years he has run his own business in a shop that he built by himself. 

Hovhannes sells food and household goods, which he buys from distributors and from the wholesale depot. His wife works with him in the shop and replaces him when he goes to purchase merchandise.
  
Hovhannes has received 10 loans from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy canned foods, cereals, sweets, candy, etc., for his shop.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, cereals, sweets, candy, etc., for his shop.

loans.name: Sadaf's Group

texts.en:
Sadaf has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s painting business. He is a painter by trade. He paints walls, doors and windows. He gets work on a contract basis. He gets good money after finishing the work.  He has some permanent and some new clients. His permanent clients always approach him whenever they are in need of painting work due to his good services. The earned income allows him to manage the household expenses. 

Sadaf is a very caring lady, takes care of her family and providing them comfort by fulfilling their needs. She cooks  good and healthy food for them so they remain healthy. She specially takes care of her husband’s health because she knows that his job requires lots of hard work and struggle and his good health is very necessary. 

With the loan, he will buy paint brushes and also some paint to provide better services to his clients and earn better. 

Sadaf is hopeful that the loan investment will have a positive impact on his business and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sadaf.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes and paint for painting business.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 40-year-old business lady who has been running a green grocery shop since 1994. Prior to this, she was selling only potatoes. 

She is married and blessed with four children age 29, 25, 21 and 19. 

In the next five years, she hopes to become a well established business lady in her local community and to open up other business outlets.
 
She has requested 30,000 KES to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, avocados and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 24 years old. She has three children who range in age from 1 to 7. Two are in school. 

She works with her husband. They sell Irish potatoes on a wholesale scale. Immaculate has done this business for more than seven years. The profits have enabled them to expand the business and meet the needs of her family.

She needs to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes. She wishes to save all her profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
Carine is 24 years old. She has a 4-year-old child in school. Her husband works in a hotel. 

She sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling clothes for the past two years. Her business is going well. the profits enabled her to build a house. 

She needs a loan to buy more clothes and make more profits. With the profits she plans to make some more savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been operating a general shop where he sells soap, cooking fat and other consumable household goods. He is 34 years old and married. He works hard in his business so as to earn enough income to meet his family’s needs.

He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one and open other outlets within five years. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice and beans.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy has been running a retail shop for three years selling maize, rice, spices, sugar and cooking fat.   She is 33 years old, married, and a proud mother of two children ages 8 and 3 years old.  

She hopes to grow her business into a mini-supermarket within five years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving her finances to inject into her business and thus able to provide for her family.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cereals such as rice, peas and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, peas and beans

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik was born in 1954 and lives in Berkaber village, Tavush marz, or province. Yurik is married and has two sons: one of his sons now is living in Russia, and second one lives with Yurik. 

Yurik works in village administration and at the same time he, his wife and his son engage in animal breeding and gardening. They breed cows, turkeys and chickens. In their garden, they grow fig and persimmon trees. Thanks to their joint efforts, they are able to manage their farm and to support their family. 

Yurik intends to improve his farm, so he wants to start swine breeding on his farm. Therefore, he is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy some pigs and fodder for them. This is Yurik’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy some pigs and fodder for them

loans.name: Danston

texts.en:
Danston has been operating a hardware shop for three years. He is 34 years old, happily married and a proud father of two children aged 4 and 1-1/2 years. 
 
His dreams and aspirations are to become a major supplier of hardware materials and to be a contractor. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on business management skills. This has helped him to run his business well.  

He has requested 70, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy switches, electrical cables and florescent fittings.

loans.use: to buy switches, electrical cables and florescent fittings.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and a hard-working business lady. She is happily married and she is a proud mother of two children, 11 and 3. She has been selling fruit for four years. 

She hopes to become a major supplier of fruit to all major towns in the country. She also wants to open up several outlets within five years. Through attending Faulu Kenya seminars, she has been able to learn the art of customer care and good customer relations and for this she is grateful to Faulu Kenya.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruit.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle for transporting eggs

loans.name: Koli Aminatou

texts.fr: Agée de 26ans et maman de 02 enfants, Koli est à son second cycle de prêt et vend des produits de premières  nécessités (huile, sucre, riz, tomate, cube) à domicile. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et a démarré en 2005. Elle veut cet argent pour renforcer son activité afin d’assurer son devoir de femme au ménage. Son conjoint est revendeur.
texts.en: Koli is 26 years old and the mother of two children. She is on her second loan cycle and sells basic necessities (oil, sugar, rice, tomatoes, bouillon cubes) at home. She gets her supplies from the market in Lomé and started this activity in 2005. She wants to use the money to strengthen her business and fulfill her duties as housewife. Her spouse is a reseller.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Shirak

texts.en:
Shirak was born in 1965 and lives in Aknaghbyur village, Ijevan area. Shirak lives with his wife and his son and daughter, who are students, and with his retiree mother.

For a long time, Shirak worked as workman and, since 1992, he and his family have engaged in animal breeding, bee keeping and gardening. With the profit from his agricultural business, Shirak can support his family's needs. He likes his agricultural occupation very much, so he works very hard and with much pleasure. He especially likes to take care of his bee colonies. He says bee keeping is a hard and exacting business, which demands a lot of knowledge, but at the same time it is very profitable and interesting.

Shirak needs a 700.000 AMD loan to add more bees and also to buy some calves and fodder.

loans.use: to add bees and also to buy some calves and fodder

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans et maman de 04 enfants, Afi est à son second cycle de prêt et vend des produits de premières  nécessités (huile, sucre, riz, tomate, cube) dans sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et a démarré en 1995. Elle veut cet argent pour renforcer son activité afin d’assurer son devoir de femme au ménage. Son conjoint est agronome.
texts.en: Afi is 47 years old and the mother of four children. She is on her second loan cycle and sells basic necessities (oil, sugar, rice, tomatoes, bouillon cubes…) in her shop. She gets her supplies from the market in Lomé and started this activity in 1995. She wants to use the money to strengthen her business and fulfill her duties as housewife. Her spouse is an agronomist.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Grossiste d’eau  minérale mise en sachet appelée chez « PURE  WATER » depuis 2008. Mariama s’approvisionne chez les producteurs de l’eau  et revend à la maison. Son mari est tôlier et ils ont en charge 03 enfants.
texts.en: Since 2008, Mariama has been a wholesaler of mineral water sold in bags of the "Pure Water" brand. She buys from the producers and resells the water from her home. Her husband is a sheet metal worker and they care for three children.

loans.use: to buy mineral water

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and a focused single young man. He has been running a butchery for one year. He earns extra income by carrying out dairy farming. 

In the next five years, he wants to transform his business into a restaurant. He harbors dreams of being a meat distributor and to open other outlets. He wants to realize this dream by working closely with Faulu Kenya.   Hence he has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 42 years old and married with one child who is 3 years of age. She owns a bakery in which she sells bread so she will use the loan to buy bread making ingredients. 

She started with selling shoes using the capital she was given by relatives. She then opened up her own bakery and it is now 16 years later. This business enabled her to meet her needs and save for her children's school fees. With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Concilie

texts.en:
Concilie is 36 years old and married with three children. The eldest is 14 years of age and the youngest is 8 years old. They are all in school. 

She owns a shop where she sells soap, sugar, salt, flour and has a small bar. It’s now three years since the business started, therefore the loan will be used to increase capital. She will use the profits to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Doryfe

texts.en:
Doryfe is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Doryfe is raising pigs to sell. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Doryfe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Doryfe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 51 years old. She has two children who are ages 16 and 9 years old. Both of them are in school. Her husband constructs houses.

She owns a bar and restaurant. She started back in 1996 selling local brew and later on with the profits from the bar she started up a restaurant. She needs a loan to increase her capital by buying more beer and food stuffs. She will also buy crops from outside the city for sale from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy beer and food stuffs for both her bar and restaurant.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is 35 years old and married. She has two children whose ages are 3 and 1. Her husband is a driver, and she sells secondhand clothes. This business has enabled her to meet all her needs. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale. It’s now been one year since the business started. She plans to open up a clothing shop from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 28-year-old business lady who has been in the fashion industry for three years, tailoring clothes. She is married and blessed with two children, ages 8 and 4. She is confident that within five years, she will be a well-established business lady. She hopes to expand her market niche. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her the art of saving. She wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gearbox

loans.name: Zaninka Jeanine

texts.en:
Zaninka Jeanine is 36 years old. She has 2 children whose ages range between 4 and 16 years. They are both in school. She is a single mother. She sells house utensils. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and to feed her family.

This loan will be used to buy more household utensils. Zaninka has been able to buy a restaurant in the market. She has spent two years in the business. The profits will be used to rent another place in the market in which she will open up another business. In the future she is planning to open up a hardware shop because she thinks it's profitable.

loans.use: to buy restaurant equipment.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Esperanza has a shop that sells snacks, biscuits & breads. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & bread. Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & bread.

loans.name: Sandra Devotha

texts.en: Sandra Devotha is 24 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 5 years and 5 months old. Her husband is a driver. Sandra Devotha sells secondhand clothes and baskets. She started with just a few baskets, but now she sells many of them. It's been 8 months since the business started. Sandra Devotha needs a loan to buy more baskets and make more profits. She will buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy baskets for sale

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Angeles is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the maintenance of the service. Angeles is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 37 years old. She is not married. She separated from her husband. They had no children. Constance sells utensils such as cups, flasks, etc. and she has been doing this business for the past 10 years. This business enabled her to buy a family house and 2 pieces of land. It has also enabled her to meet most of her needs. 

She needs a loan to buy more utensils in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy utensils, such as cups

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, a 33-year-old married mother of four in the Philippines, has operated a retail shop that sells biscuits, beverages and canned goods for five years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods. In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en: Germaine, a single and childless 23-year-old, has been a tailor for the past five months. This business has enabled her to help support her relatives, and she is now requesting a loan to buy tailoring materials such as fabrics, threads and niddles in order to make more profits. Germane plans to reinvest the profits in her  business.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials for her business.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda, a 57-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that sells coconuts and green bananas for the past five years. A member of HSPFI  since 2009, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and beverages to sell. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Menuisier de profession, Komlan a ouvert un atelier depuis 2005. Il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de meubles (chaises, garde à manger tables) Il sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter du bois à Lomé afin de fabriquer des meubles. Il a 34ans et père de 02 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en: A carpenter by trade, Komlan opened a workshop in 2005. He specializes in manufacturing furniture (chairs, pantries, tables) He is requesting this third loan to buy wood in Lomé to make furniture. He is 34 years old and the father of two children. His wife is a reseller.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian, a 26-year-old mother of three children ranging in age from one to six, is married to a driver. Lillian has been selling mobile phones for the past eight years, during which time she has been able to expand her business and meet the needs of her family.

Now requesting a loan to buy more phones to sell in order to make more profits, Lillian plans to use those profits to begin building a house on the piece of land she recently bought.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for sale.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu, a 45-year-old married mother of two living in the Philippines, has operated a retail shop that sells clothing such as t-shirts and blouses from NATASHA & AVON for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell. In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn, a 30-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling ready-to-wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses for the past two years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is 25 years old and single. For more than two years now, she has made a living by running a bar and a restaurant, and her success has allowed her to continually expand her business. She is applying for this loan to continue that expansion and increase her profits by buying more beer and soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Suana

texts.en:
Suana is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Suana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Agé de 28ans, Yao travaille à togotelecom. Il veut bien assurer son devoir de père de famille c’est pour cela il ajoute à son activité principale une salle de jeux vidéo. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des jeux vidéo pour que les enfants viennent jouer en période de vacance.
texts.en: Yao is 28 years old and works in TogoTelecom. He wants to fulfill his duties as a father which is why he is adding to his main activity a video arcade. This loan will enable him to buy video games for children to come and play during school vacations.

loans.use: to buy video games

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.en:
Mathieu is 30 years old, and he has three children who are between the ages of 8 months and 7 years. He owns a general store in which he sells different kinds of items which include sugar, salt, matches and some foodstuffs such as maize flour. He has run this business for the past six years and it has enabled him meet the needs of his family and educate his children as well. 

He needs a loan to buy more items in order to make more profits. Mathieu plans to save the profits until he can begin constructing a house for himself.

loans.use: to buy items for his general store.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Juanita has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more snacks, canned goods and beverages to sell. Juanita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of three children and has for the last several years made a living selling candies, biscuits and bread. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Sally is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Yesyes

texts.en:
Yesyes is 32 years old, and she has two children who are ages 9 and 14 years old. They are both in school. She is a widow. 

Yesyes own a bar and a shoe wholesale shop in which she sells  different kinds of beer and shoes respectively. She has done this business for the past three years and her business is going on well. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and expand her business as well. She needs a loan to reinvest in her shoe business, buying more shoes for sale.She plans to re-invest her profits.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Ronilo has a shop that sells snacks, bread & beverages. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles.

Ronilo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ronilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Julieta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Liezel has a retail shop that sells vegetables like eggplant & string beans. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables for sale.

Liezel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Dima

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 33ans,  Dima achète des ignames à ANIE et revend dans un marché de la place.  Elle a deux enfants et son mari est revendeur. Elle vend aussi des assiettes et des boites de conserves. Elle veut stocker des marchandises pour répondre plus à la demande.
texts.en: A young lady of 33 years, Dima buys yams in Anie and resells them in a local market. She has two children and her husband is a reseller. She also sells plates and canned food. She wants to stock more goods to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: May Amor

texts.en:
May Amor is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

May Amor has a retail shop and eatery that sells & serves different dishes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

May Amor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, May Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of four children and has earned a living for the past year by running a retail shop where she sells candies, biscuits, canned goods and snacks. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Edoh Adjoa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, Edoh est veuve et a 05 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2007 et est à son premier cycle de prêt.
texts.en: A retailer of charcoal at her home, Edoh is a widow caring for five children. She wants to provide a better future for her children and requests this loan to buy goods in Lomé. She started this activity in 2007 and is on her first loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 44 years old and he lives in Aknaghbyur village of Tavush area.  Rashid lives with his mother and his brother’s family. 
Rashid and his family engage in cattle and chicken breeding, beekeeping and land cultivation. Rashid’s mother is retiree, but she also helps her sons with their farming. Thanks to profit from their occupation they solve their family’s needs.
Rashid asks for a 700.000 AMD loan to improve his harvesting process and will use the funds to buy a fuel for his harvesting machine, to pay for mowed hay transportation from field to his farm, and also to pay a rent to village administration for a plot of land, because hay from his own field doesn't enough for his farm animals, as well as to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for harvesting machine, to pay a rent for a plot of land, and to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy generic medical products

loans.name: Lourline

texts.en:
Lourline is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lourline has a retail shop that sells bread, detergents, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lourline is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lourline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ayité

texts.fr: Ayité est papa de 03 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils habitent ensemble Bé-KPOTA (un quartier du pays. Il est électricien et a ouvert son atelier  en 2011. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pièces détachées  à Lomé.
texts.en: Ayité is the father of three children. His wife is a reseller and they live together in the Bé-Kpota neighborhood. He is an electrician and opened his workshop in 2011. He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is 39 years old; he lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with his mother, his wife and two under-age sons. 

Over 15 years Gurgen has engaged in farming: animal breeding and land cultivation. On his farm he rears cows, sheep and chickens. Gurgen’s wife and mother, who is already a pensioner, help him in his hard occupation and thus they are able to support their family. 

Gurgen wants to develop his farm, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in future. For his farm development, Gurgen is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan, which he is going to spend on10 sheep and fodder. This is his second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marifel has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Marifel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Afi Sika

texts.fr: Responsable d’une boutique de mèches et des produits de beauté, Afi est une jeune dame de 28ans qui n’aime pas baissé les bras. Son mari est commercent et ils ont 02 enfants en charge. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter de marchandises. Elle a commencé en 2009
texts.en: Responsible for a shop selling hair weaves and beauty products, Afi is a young 28-year-old lady who does not give up easily. Her husband is a merchant and they have two children under their care. This loan will allow her to purchase goods. She began this activity in 2009.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and beauty products

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Beatriz has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy detergents, noodles & snacks.

Beatriz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Beatriz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, noodles & snacks.

loans.name: Vodu

texts.fr: Agée de 56ans, Vodu est revendeuse  ambulante de pagnes. Elle a démarré en 1995 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et surtout avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer. Son mari est coiffeur.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Vodu is a street vendor of 'pagnes'. She started in 1995 by getting her supplies from the Grand Market in Lomé.
She wants this loan to strengthen her business, and in particular to get a shop for a better set up. Her husband is a hairdresser.

loans.use: to buy 'pagnes' (traditional West-African cloth).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of four children and has for the last five years earned a living by running a shop where she sells snacks, breads and biscuits. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 34ans, Adjo est revendeuse  ambulante de bazins (pagnes teintés très appréciés en Afrique). Elle a démarré en 2005 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et surtout avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer. Son mari est mécanicien chauffeur, ils ont 01 enfant.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Adjo is a street vendor of brocade (died fabric very popular in Africa). She started in 2005, by getting her products from wholesalers.
She wants this loan to strengthen her business, in particular to get a shop for a better set up.
Her husband is a driver and car mechanic. They have one child.

loans.use: to purchase brocade (fabric).

loans.name: Atsupui

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, Atsupui est mariée et a 01 enfant. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2008 et est à son deuxième  cycle de prêt. Son mari est comptable.
texts.en: Atsupui is married, has one child and sells charcoal from her home. As she wants to secure a better future for her child, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise in Lome. She started her business in 2008 and is in her second round of loans. Her husband is an accountant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of five children, and has for three years made a living by selling snacks, detergents and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mely has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Mely is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Mercy has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages. Mercy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Ganillatou

texts.fr: Née 2 août 1977 au Bénin, Ganillatou est une veuve qui à trois enfants dont un reste encore à sa charge. Ganillatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant Ganillatou mène comme activité la vente des produits divers et des ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités Ganillatou assure les différentes dépenses de sa famille. Ganillatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et vend ses produits à son domicile. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Ganillatou sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Ganillatou was born in Benin on August 2, 1977. She is widowed and the mother of three children, with one still in her care. Ganillatou never attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her child, she sells various articles and plastic kitchen utensils. Thanks to her income from this activity, Ganillatou pays for the various household expenses. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin and sells her goods out of her home. Eager to satisfy her customers and raise her standard of living, Ganillatou came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan.

loans.use: to buy various products and plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Yhayhannee

texts.en:
Yhayhannee is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Yhayhannee has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Yhayhannee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Yhayhannee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Christelle Mireille

texts.fr: Née le 22 juin 1972 au Bénin, Christelle Mireille est mariée à un certain Aristide. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christelle Mireille vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Christelle Mireille assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Christelle Mireille  n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Christelle Mireille vend des boissons non alcoolisées et des produits divers. Christelle Mireille s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Christelle Mireille sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Christelle Mireille was born in Benin on June 22, 1972 and is married to Aristide. The spouses have three children in their care, all attending school. Christelle Mireille lives with her husband and the children. She shares household expenses with her husband. Christelle Mireille never attended school.

To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells non-alcoholic beverages and various articles. She buys her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. Thanks to her income from this activity, she pays for the various family expenses. In order to continuously strengthen her activity level and increase her profit, Christelle Mireille came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her first loan.

loans.use: to buy non-alcoholic drinks and various articles (pasta, soap, canned food).

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Revendeur de pièces détachées, Kodjo a 30ans et a démarré en 2003. Il s’approvisionne à ACCRA. Il veut assurer sa future vie maritale et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Kodjo is 30 years old and started his business of selling spare parts in 2003. He purchases his merchandise in Accra. He wants ensure that he can afford to get married in future and is requesting the loan to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Nanita

texts.en:
Nanita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Nanita has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles & food seasonings. Nanita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & food seasonings.

loans.name: Ramcy

texts.en:
Ramcy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. 

Ramcy has a rice & corn farm for agricultural business. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the rice field. Ramcy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ramcy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Greg

texts.en:
Greg is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. 

Greg has corn field that sells corn grains at the time of harvest. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the corn field. Greg is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Greg hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hens

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Rosalie has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, AKOUVI est mariée et a 03 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à BASSAR et SOKODE. Elle a démarré en 2007 et est à son premier  cycle de prêt. Son mari est jardinier.
texts.en: Akouvi, a retailer of charcoal out of her home, is married and the mother of three children. She wants to ensure a better future to her children and applies for this loan to buy goods in Bassar and Sokodé. She launched her business in 2007 and is now in her first loan cycle. Her husband is a gardener.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Helenita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Helenita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Helenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mahudegbe Group

texts.fr: MAHUDEGBE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui sont toutes des amies et dont la  représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Léa Akoua. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même famille. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Léa Akoua est née le 22 Mars 1978 au Bénin. Léa Akoua est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Léa Akoua n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille, Léa Akoua vend des céréales à son domicile. Léa Akoua s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Léa Akoua et aux autres membres du groupe MAHUDEGBE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mahudegbe is a group composed of three people sharing bonds of friendship. The representative of the group, who is raising her hand in the photo, is Léa Akoua. The members of the group belong to the same family. It is the third time that the group applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé to increase their working capital.

Léa Akoua was born in Benin on March 22, 1978. She is married to Bienvenu, a driver. The spouses have two children, all attending school and living with their parents. Léa Akoua did not attend school.

To provide for her needs and those of her family, Léa Akoua sells cereals out of her home. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. This activity generates enough profit to enable her to pay for the various family expenses. This third loan will definitely allow Léa Akoua and her fellow members of Mahudegbe Group to boost their activity level and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.en:
Wilbert is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. 

Wilbert has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional bananas & coconuts.

Wilbert is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wilbert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Adiatou

texts.fr: Née en 1982 au Bénin, Adiatou est mariée à un certain Idrissou. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Adiatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Adiatou assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Adiatou a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Adiatou vend des tissus dans son quartier. Adiatou s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Adiatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adiatou was born in Benin in 1982. She is married to Idrissou. The spouses have two children, all attending school and in their care. Adiatou lives with her husband and the children. She shares household expenses with her husband. Adiatou has had very little formal education.

To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells fabrics in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies at one of the largest markets in Benin. Thanks to her income from this activity, she pays for the various family expenses. In order to continuously strengthen her activity level and increase her profit, Adiatou came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan. The previous two loans have been repaid on schedule.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Annaliza has a retail shop that sells detergents, cleaning agents & snacks. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional products from PERSONAL CARE.

Annaliza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from PERSONAL CARE.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Madeleine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Sosthène. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Madeleine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Madeleine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Madeleine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Madeleine vend des épices (oignon, ail, poivron etc.) et de l'huile végétale. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit,  Madeleine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Madeleine was born in Benin in 1976. She is married to Sosthène, a merchant. The spouses have four children, all attending school and in their care. Madeleine lives with her husband and her children. She shares household expenses with her husband. Madeleine never attended school.

To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells spices (onions, garlic, peppers, etc.) and vegetable oil. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. Thanks to her income from this activity, she pays for the various family expenses. In order to continuously strengthen her activity level and increase her profit, Madeleine came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy spices and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Bidossessi-2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI-2 est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies . La représentante du groupe, du nom de kpodozon est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. kpodozon est née en 1975 au Bénin et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Vikpozoukan. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. kpodozon n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, kpodozon  prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce, etc.) qu’elle vend  depuis quatre ans environ. kpodozon s’approvisionne en maïs et en condiment de sauce dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, kpodozon sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI-2, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The Bidossessi-2 group is made up of three friends. The group's representative, called Kpodozon, is the lady in the photograph with her hand raised. She was born in 1975 in Benin, and is married to a salesman called Vikopozoukan. They have two children who live with them and attend school. Kpodozon never went to school. To see to her family's needs she has prepared and sold food such as corn paste with sauce, a trade she entered four years ago. She sources her corn and condiments from a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers' demand and to boost her revenue she, along with the other Bidossessi-2 group members, is seeking a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building tools

loans.name: H. Agnès

texts.fr: Née le 07 janvier 1965 au Bénin, Agnès est mariée à un instituteur du nom de Pierre. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Agnès assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Agnès prépare de la nourriture (riz, haricot) qu'elle vend dans un marché du Bénin. Agnès s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Agnès sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Agnès was born on the 7th January 1965 in Benin.  She is married to a primary school teacher called Pierre with whom she has five children who all attend school. She lives with her husband and children, and works with him to see to the family's needs. She never went to school and today sells prepared food (rice, beans) from a market in Benin. She sources her goods from one of Benin's markets, and the revenue from selling them helps her to see to her family's costs. In order to boost her business and grow her profit levels she is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and cooking condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Ayélévi

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Ayélévi est mariée à un enseignant. Elle a 01 enfant. Elle veut acheter de la machine à coudre c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de répondre a l’attente de ses clients.
texts.en: Ayélévi is a seamstress by trade and is married to a teacher with whom she has a child. She would like to purchase a sewing machine and so is seeking a loan so that she can better meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Hokponto

texts.fr: Née en 1959 au Bénin, Hokponto est mariée à un gardien du nom de Oké. Le couple cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Hokponto vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Hokponto assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Hokponto n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Hokponto vend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante. Hokponto s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Hokponto sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1959 in Benin, Hokponto is married to Oké, a security guard. The couple has five children, all still in their care. Some of the children are in school. Hokponto lives with her husband and children. She provides for the different household needs jointly with her husband. Hokponto never attended school. To  support herself and her children, she sells smoked fish as a street vendor. Hokponto stocks up at a market in Benin. This business brings her an income helping her to cover different family expenses. With the goal of growing her business further and increasing her profits, Hokponto is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Akouavi est mariée à un revendeur. Elle a 04 enfants. Elle veut acheter de la machine à coudre, des articles de mercerie c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de répondre a l’attente de ses clients. Elle a 09 apprentis.
texts.en: A seamstress by trade, Akouavi is married to a vendor. She has four children. She would like to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies, which is why she is seeking this loan, so as to be able to better meet her customers’ needs. She has nine apprentices.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mawoussi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, MAWOUSSI  est mariée et a 02 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à KARA. Elle a démarré en 2004 et est à son premier cycle de prêt. Son mari est mécanicien auto.
texts.en: Mawoussi sells charcoal out of her home. She is married with two children. She would like to ensure a better future for her children and is seeking this loan to stock up in Karra. She launched this business in 2004, and is on her first loan. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and wigs

loans.name: Mahukpego Djeffa Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO DJEFFA est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Louise Martine. Les membres du groupe exercent leurs activités dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Louise Martine est née le 15 Mars 1975 au Bénin et est mariée à Emmanuel, un hôtelier. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Louise Martine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Louise Martine vend des produits de quincaillerie dans son quartier. Louise Martine exerce cette activité depuis près de quatre ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Louise Martine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Louise Martine et aux autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO DJEFFA de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: MAHUKPEGO DJEFFA is a group consisting of three people, whose representative (the one with the raised hand in the photo) is named Louise-Martine.  The group members operate their businesses in the same neighborhood of Benin.  In order to increase their working capital, this group is asking for the second time, a loan via ALIDE.  Louise-Martine was born on March 15, 1975 in Benin and is married to Emmanuel, a hotel owner.  The couple have five children, all in school and in their care.  Louise-Martine has never attended school. To meet her needs and those of her family, Louise-Martine sells her hardware products in her neighborhood.  Louise-Martine has been in business for almost four years, which has enabled her and her husband to take care of the various family expenses.  Louise-Martine stocks up in a city of Benin. This second loan will certainly allow Louise-Martine and the other members of the MAHUKPEGO DJEFFA group to enhance the level of their business and increase their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: to purchase hardware.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has five children. All five of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Milly makes brushes and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 30 years. She sells the brushes to schools and to shops around the area. Milly is a teacher by profession. She does part time teaching in nearby schools and this brings some side income, apart from making brushes. 

Milly has requested for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more raw  materials for making brushes. Her major business challenge is ever increasing prices of raw materials for making brushes and lack of enough markets for her brushes. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making brushes.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married and has three children. All of her children go to school. She doesn't have to care for any additional family members.

Sylvia sells second hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She sells her clothes in the market. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. 

Sylvia's major business challenge is seasonality and ever increasing prices of second hand clothes. Sylvia is aspiring to see her business grow big. She wants to start importing clothes from Mombasa and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Alohagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOHAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mireille Sènami est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mireille Sènami est née en  1978 dans une ville du Bénin, et est mariée à un Plombier du nom de Patrick. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mireille Sènami a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mireille Sènami mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente de conserves, de savons et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Mireille Sènami s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mireille Sènami sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOHAGBE, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The ALOHAGBE group consists of three members who all live in the same area.  The representative of the group, named Mireille-Senami, is the one with the hand raised in the photo.  Mireille-Senami was born in 1978 in a city of Benin.  She is married to a plumber named Patrick.  The couple have three children, all in school and under their care.  Mireille-Senami dropped out of secondary school.  To provide for her needs and those of her family, Mireille-Senami has been in business for five years selling canned goods, soap, and phone cards.  Mireille-Senami stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.  In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Mireille-Senami is asking for, with the other members of the ALOHAGBE group, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, and phone cards.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 28ans, Afi est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a démarré en 2011 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes au même lieu. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: 28 yeas old, Afi is a reseller of pagnes (traditional fabric) at the grand market of Lome.  She started in 2011 and buys from wholesalers at the same market.  She wants this loan to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy pagne (traditional fabric)

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, et mère de 05 enfants, Amah est revendeuse d’huile rouge et de la farine de blé depuis 2006. Elle veut renforcer son activité en répondant plus à la demande de ses clients et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: 47 years old and mother of 5 children, Amah has been a reseller of red oil and wheat flour since 2006.  She wants to strengthen her business by responding more to the needs of her customers.  She also wants to see her children grow up under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is married with three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members to care for. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

Hanifa makes and sells brushes at the market. She has been in business for the last 10 years and works six days a week. Besides making brushes, she also has a poultry farm. She sells her goods at both wholesale and retail prices. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Hanifa decided to join MCDT because of the low interest rate charged. She has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she wants to use to buy more sticks and other raw materials for making brushes. Haifa aspires to see her business grow so that she can employ some girls to help her make brushes and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more sticks and other raw materials for making brushes.

loans.name: Noudjiou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDJIOU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. Léontine est née le 03 Avril 1963 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Ambroise. Le couple cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Léontine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Léontine vend des fruits et légumes depuis une trentaine d'année. Léontine s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léontine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDJIOU , un premier  crédit.
texts.en: The NOUDJIOU group consists of three people who are friends.  The group representative, named Leontine, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Leontine was born on April 3, 1963 in Benin and is married to Ambroise.  The couple have five children, all under their care.  Among the children, some are in school.  The children live together with their parents. Leontine has never attended school.  To support herself and her children, Leontine has been selling fruits and vegetables for thirty-some years.  Leontine stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Leontine is asking for, together with the other members of the NOUDJIOU group, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy young plants and manure.

loans.name: Degnon Group

texts.fr: DEGNON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Valérie. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même Eglise. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Valérie est née le 07 Avril 1972 au Bénin. Valérie est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Victorin. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Après avoir arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, Valérie a commencer depuis treize ans, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Valérie vend des biscuits. Valérie s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Valérie et aux autres membres du groupe DEGNON de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
DEGNON is a group made up of three people whose president (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Valérie. The members of the group belong to the same church. In order to grow their working capital, this group is asking for their third loan from ALIDé. 

Valérie was born on April 7, 1972 in Bénin. She is married to a carpenter named Victorin. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school, and live together with their children. Valérie began selling charcoal at her home 13 years ago. Secondarily, she sells cookies. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. This activity generates revenue that she uses to help support the family. This third loan will certainly permit Valérie and the other members of the group called DEGNON to expand their business and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Christine lives in a home in Kampala, Uganda, that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Christine sells charcoal. She has been doing so for a year and works seven days a week. Christine sells her products in a shop to both wholesale and retail customers. She also makes money by selling firewood. The main business challenges for Christine include transportation and the rainy season.

Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: La Volonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA VOLONTE DE DIEU est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Micheline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Micheline est née le 04 Avril 1976 au Bénin. Micheline est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Micheline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Micheline mène comme activité la vente de tissus, d'ustensiles de cuisine et de bijoux de façon secondaire, depuis une trentaine d'année. Micheline s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus, l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Micheline et aux autres membres du groupe LA VOLONTE DE DIEU, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
LA VOLONTE DE DIEU (God's Will) is a group made up of three people whose president (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Micheline. The members of the group live in the same district. Wishing to grow their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Micheline was born on April 4, 1976 in Bénin. She is married to a teacher named Christophe. The couple has three children, all enrolled in school, and living together with their parents. 

Micheline stopped attending school at the secondary level. To support herself and her children, Micheline has been selling cloth, kitchen utensils and secondarily, jewelry for some thirty years. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin. This activity generates income that helps her cover the various family expenses. This second loan will certainly help Micheline and the other members of the group LA VOLONTE DE DIEU, to expand their businesses and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and jewelry.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is single and has no children, yet she takes care of the orphans of her late children. Teopista lives in a home in Kampala, Uganda which she rents. She has access to electricity but none to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Teopista sells food from a grocery shop to both wholesale and retail customers. She has been in this business for a year and works seven days a week. Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality and thieves.

Teopista’s goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked grocery shop and a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Titomagba Group

texts.fr: TITOMAGBA est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marguerite. Les membres du groupe sont des amies de longue date. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marguerite est née en 1971 au Bénin. Marguerite est mariée à un conducteur nommé Noël. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Marguerite a commencé depuis une dizaine d'année, à préparer de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce, etc.), qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Marguerite s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Marguerite et aux autres membres du groupe TITOMAGBA de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The TITOMAGBA group consists of three people whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Marguerite.  The group members are old friends.  In order to increase their working capital, this group is asking for their third loan with ALIDE.  Marguerite was born in 1971 in Benin. She is married to a chauffeur named Noel.  The couple have three children, all in school, one of which is their dependent.  After dropping out of primary school, Marguerite started, ten years ago, to prepare food (rice, corn pasta with sauce, etc.) that she sells in her neighborhood.  Marguerite stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. This business generates income that helps her to take care of the various family expenses.  This third loan will certainly allow Marguerite and the other members of the TITOMAGBA group enahnce their business and increase their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: To buy rice, corn, and seasoning.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Joyce has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Joyce has requested  for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and rice. She also generates additional income by frying samosas. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and build her own house. Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and rice

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Aisha has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers for bananas and to build rental houses. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Lydia has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Lydia sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Lydia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second hand clothes.  The main business challenge(s) for Lydia include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second clothes and build rental houses. Lydia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose a single mother of six children, all of whom are in school, lives in  Kampala, Uganda where she has been selling food at the market for three years, seven days a week. Her main business challenges are seasonality and theft. Rose has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, and beef.   

Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.  Rose's goals and aspirations are to own a fully-stocked restaurant and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Walter tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años que esta en el colegio, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, walter trabaja en dar acabados en casas, poner  cerámica a los pisos paredes y otros, viene realizando esta labor hace 15 años, el dinero del préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 2 maquinas de acabados, 1 cortadora de porcelanato, y una amoldadora de porcelanato,y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, walter como  muchas personas tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es que su pequeño negocio con el tiempo se convierta en una pequeña empresa y así le genere mas ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, walter esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sr. Walter is 39 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son in school. His wife is in charge of the household duties. Walter does contract work to install home finishes, such as applying ceramic tiles to the floors, walls, and other structures. He has been in business for 15 years.

The money from the loan he requested will be used to buy two polishing machines, one porcelain cutter, and a porcelain mold. This will allow him to provide better service to his customers. Like many people, Walter has dreams of turning his business into a small company so that he can generate more income for the welfare of his family. He is extremely grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to him.

loans.use: to purchase machines and equipment for performing his contract work.

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
