Assa  lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Assa has a business selling crafts.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Assa sells her products at the market, retail.    

Assa has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crafts like baskets, mats and tablecloths. 

The main business challenges for Assa include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to employ women to help in making and weaving these crafts.   

Assa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more baskets, mats and tablecloths.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Christine has a tailoring business.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a shop, retail. 

Christine has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing material. She also generates additional income through selling groundnuts and popcorn.The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own  a tailoring  school and also to buy a plot of land.   Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty  lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Betty   has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Betty   has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.    

 The main business challenges for Betty include competition and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also own a delivery van. 

Betty lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Deymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Deymi lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Keny, Deimy, Araceli y Marina. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Keny de 23 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y sopa los fines de semana, además tiene una pequeña pulperia. Este negocio lo  inicio con la venta de tortas de papa  y con las ganancias y los créditos fue aumentándolo. 

Ella tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años quienes son su inspiración y sueña en tener una gran pulpería.

Mientras Deimi de 22 años vende frijoles cocidos hace 5 años y tiene una pequeña venta, Araceli vende verduras y frutas y Marina es comerciante de prendas de oro y plata y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Deymi Group consists of four hardworking women:  Keny, Deimy, Araceli, and Marina.  The group coordinator is Sra. Keny, age 23.  She sells food and soup on the weekends.  In addition, she manages a small store.  Keny started her business selling potato cakes and has been able to expand by utilizing her profits and loans.  She has three children (ages 7, 4, and 3) who provide her with inspiration.  Keny dreams of having a larger store.  

Deimy, age 22, has been selling cooked beans for five years and also manages a small store.  Araceli sells vegetables and fruits.  Marina is a merchant who sells gold and silver jewelry, as well as cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meat, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Sergida is one of the members of the “La Familia Renacer 3 y 4” (To Be a Reborn Family 3 & 4) group which has 10 micro-businesswomen and businessmen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Sergida’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their three children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys cooking and being at home with her family.

Sergida is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth. She has had her business for about 6 years; she started it with a little money she had in savings. Sergida is running a fried food stall, and she is planning on investing the new loan by buying meats, vegetables, cooking oil, flour and other goods.

She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save for her dreams, having a restaurant and her own house.

She lives in the city of Santiago which is the country’s second largest. Its economy depends on agriculture, cattle-raising and tobacco farming, among others. It also has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities of very limited resources.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, plantains, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Antonela lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nandasmo. La señora Lidia del Carmen de 45 años de edad tiene varios negocios ella es propietaria de una pulpería, vende nacatamales los fines de semana y vende plantas.
Lidia invertirá el crédito principalmente en la realización de nacatamales y en sus otros negocios.
Las otras integrantes son Johana del Carmen quien vende hojas y ropa, y Leoncita vende pollo en su casa y tiene un cafetín en la escuela R. Darío.
texts.en:
The Antonela Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women who are originally from Nandasmo.

Sra. Lidia del Carmen is 45 years old and has different businesses. She is the owner of a grocery store, sells Nicaraguan tamales on the weekends, and sells plants. Lidia will invest her loan primarily in the production of Nicaraguan tamales, but she will use some of the money for her other businesses.

The other members of the group are Johana del Carmen, who sells bed sheets and clothing, and Leoncita, who sells chicken at home and manages a cafeteria at the R. Dario School.

loans.use: to purchase pork, corn, spices, leaves, firewood, and other items.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is divorced and has three children, all of whom are in school. For less than a year, Constance has operated a business selling cereals in a shop seven days a week. She also generates additional income through room rentals. She is requesting a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sorghum and millet. Seasonality and transportation are Constance's main business challenges.

Constance lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Constance aspires to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Jesús Mi Proveedor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús mi proveedor lo conforman David Antonio, María Teresa y Carelia del Rosario, originarios de Diriomo. El coordinador es el señor David Antonio de 40 años de edad. Él se dedica al comercio de leche la cual distribuye en distintas comunidades por medio de su moto.   
El con el crédito comprara  leche para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
Mientras María Teresa  y  Carelia del Rosario se dedican al comercio de pan artesanal y a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas de temporada.
texts.en: The group "Jesús Mi Proveedor" ("Jesus, My Provider"), consists of David Antonio, María Teresa and Carelia del Rosario, who come from Diriomo.  The coordinator is Señor David Anthony, who is 40 years old.  He sells milk, which he distributes in various communities via his motorbike.  With the loan, he will buy milk to further strengthen his business.  Meanwhile, María Teresa and Carelia del Rosario work selling artisanal bread and buying and selling seasonal fruit.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, humilde y entusiasta de 55 años quien desde los 16 años se dedica a la venta de manera ambulante frutas y bebidas típicas como pinolillo, pinol, pozol…etc.  
Este negocio es familiar ella trabaja con su madre y hermano e invertirá el crédito en semilla de jícaro, maíz, cacao, leña…etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pascuala del Carmen is a hardworking, enterprising, humble and enthusiastic woman. She is 55 years old. Since she was 16 she has been selling fruit and traditional drinks such as pinolillo (a cornmeal and cocoa drink), pinol (a ground corn, cocoa and spice drink), pozol (a  hot cornmeal drink), etc. She is a roving salesperson.
This is a family business. She works with her mother and brother. She will use the loan to buy jicaro seed (a local variety of tree), corn, cocoa, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy jicaro seed, corn, cocoa, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente en la escuela R. Darío de Diría, Masaya. Ella se ha desempeñado como maestra desde hace 20 años.
El crédito que solicito la señora Nidia es personal el cual utilizara para reparar su vivienda en especial el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia Elena is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a schoolteacher in Masaya. She has been working as a teacher for the past twenty years.
Mrs. Nidia is requesting this personal loan in order to make repairs to her house, especially the roof of her house.

loans.use: to improve her house, especially the roof.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 52-year-old married woman with five children who have all finished their studies. She lives in the village of Rizal West within San Isidro in the Philippines.

Merlita has raised hogs and had a motorcycle transport business for the past three years. She is able to earn per month about 3,000 PHP raising hogs and 2,000 PHP through her motorcycle transport.

Merlita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs and a new sprocket for her motorcycle. In the future she hopes to increase her profits by improving her businesses so that she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and a new sprocket for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Esperando En Dios 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Marlene is the coordinator of her group Esperando en Dios (Hoping with God), and her story is representative of others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients overall. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and five children.

Marlene sells candies, snacks and other groceries from her mobile stall, which she takes to some schools and to many other different places. She has been in this business for around three years.

Marlene started her business when she took out her first Esperanza loan. She is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after successfully repaying her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more candies, snacks and other groceries for her mobile stall.

She has contributed to her household needs through this extra income. She hopes to have a big grocery stall, and her dream is then to buy a local stall for her business and stop selling by walking. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy snack, candies, gum, etc. for her mobile stall.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Ruth sells fruits and vegetables. She has done so for seven years, working seven days a week. Ruth sells her produce at retail at the market. She also rents rooms. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow Cavendish bananas. Her goal for her business is to start going directly to farmers for her yellow bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bunches and clusters of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Malinche lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Amanda de 66 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, gaseosa y chiverías. Ella tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solos tres menores de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad dependen de ella.
El crédito lo invertirá en arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y gaseosas…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Nester Antonio de 43 años él trabaja de a domicilio en la reparación de aires acondicionados y con el crédito desea instalar su taller de refrigeración; y María Virginia de 31 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Malinche Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mrs. Rosa Amanda, who is 66 years old and sells basic supplies such as grains, sodas and dairy products. She has nine children of which three are minors (16, 14, and 10 years old) and dependent on her.
This loan she will use to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, sodas, etc.
Another member is Nester Antonio who is 43 years old and works from his home repairing air conditioners. He would like this loan in order to build a refrigeration workshop. Maria Virginia is the other applicant. She is 31 years old and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). 

Constance has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Constance sells her products at the market.  Constance has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Constance include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start going to the villages for charcoal.   

Constance lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Los Tres Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo los tres girasoles lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Jeaneth de 34 años ella se dedica al comercio de ropa. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de hielo, helado y chocobananos…etc. con las ganancias empezó a traer encargos en prendas, perfumes, cosméticos y compro pacas de ropa. 
Cuando inicio con los préstamos decidió solo vender ropa y empezó a comprar ropa nueva y trae encargos. Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería en ropa.
Las otras integrantes son Alicia de 38 quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consististe en comida frita y realiza sopas de mondongo, y Gladys vende nacatamales y sopa.
texts.en:
The group "Los Tres Girasoles" (The Three Sunflowers") is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Señora Jeaneth, aged 34, who has a clothing business. She started this business with the sale of ice, ice cream and chocolate-dipped bananas, etc.  With the profits she began to offer garments, perfumes and cosmetics and to buy bales of clothes.  When she started getting loans, she decided to just sell clothes and started buying new clothes and getting orders.  She will buy clothing merchandise with the loan.

The other group members are Alicia, 38, who has a popular fried-food restaurant which serves fried food and tripe soup, and Gladis who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and soup.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 42 years old and married. She has been selling cosmetics for almost six years. For a year she also has had a retail shop where she sells different kinds of goods such as bread, sugar, milk, snacks, soft drinks and some cosmetics.

Each month Olivia makes about 4,000 PHP from her store and 5,000 PHP in cosmetics sales. Olivia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, milk, and cosmetics for her store.

In the future Olivia hopes to maintain her business so that she can send her children through higher levels of education and sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, milk, and some cosmetics products for her store.

loans.name: Asamblea De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asamblea de Dios lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Verónica del Socorro de 41 años quien se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años. Este es un negocio familiar el cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo con la ayuda de sus hijos de 19, 18 y 17 años de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en telas y material de trabajo (hilo, agujas, cintas, encajes…etc.)
Las otras integrantes son Ángela de 75 años de edad quien vende shorts, camisas, piyamas…etc. desde hace 4 años en Rivas; y María Teresa de 58 se dedica a realizar cereales  los cuales vende en las ferias.
texts.en:
The Assembly of God Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of the women is Mrs. Verónica, who is 41 years old and has been a seamstress for the past ten years. This is a family business that has slowly grown over the years with the help of her children, ages 19, 18 and 17. This loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials such as thread, needles, belts, elastic, etc.
Another member of the group is Angela, who is 75 years old and sells shorts, shirts, pajamas, etc. She has been doing this work for the past four years in the town of Rivas. The last member of the group is Maria Theresa who is 58 years old. She sells grains at the market.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Santos Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Santos Elvira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 48 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y tiene una carnicería la cual inicio su esposo y cuando empezó a trabajar ella quedo a cargo. 
Santos con el crédito comprara de carne y cosméticos y su meta es tener una moto para ir a vender a Veracruz, Inca, Nindiri…etc. y otros lugares.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad y quien la acompaña es su pequeña nieta de tres años.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Elvira is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is 48 years old.  She works in cosmetics and has a butcher business which her husband began; when she started working there she took charge.

With the loan, she will purchase meat and cosmetics, and her goal is to be able to have a motorbike with which to go and sell in Veracruz, Inca, Nindiri, etc., and elsewhere.

She has four grown children and also a little granddaughter who is three years old.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, 55, is a married woman with three children. For five years she has sold frozen foods such as longanisa, tocino and hotdogs to the people in her community.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients needed for her food processing and sales. She hopes to use this loan to maintain her business and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for her frozen food processing and sales.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 56 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio de productos AVON desde hace 10 años. Con este negocio saco adelante a sus dos hijos de 14 y 19 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas que tiene de encargo.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana Maria is a hardworking and enterprising 56-year-old woman. She has been selling AVON products for the past ten years. With this loan she will be able to help her children, ages 14 and 19, progress with the business as they currently assist her with the business. This loan will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and creams.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina  de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 53 años quien tiene una sastrería desde hace 30 años el cual inicio junto a su esposo. Ellos iniciaron ofreciendo su producto en el mercado y poco a poco fueron creciendo debido a su ardua labor y buena coordinación, su esposo es el que se encarga de las ventas y ella maneja el taller y a los seis operarios que trabajan con ellos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en telas especialmente para un pedido de unos uniformes de agencia de seguridad los cuales son más de 100 uniformes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Christina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is 53 years old. She has had a tailor shop for the past 30 years. She began this business with her husband.  In the beginning they sold their products in the marketplace. Little by little their business grew because of their hard work and cooperation. Her husband is in charge of sales and Maria Christina manages the workshop, which includes six employees.
Maria Christina will invest the loan money in fabric, especially fabric for uniforms for security guard agencies that currently have more than 100 uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make uniforms.

loans.name: La Buena Union Group

texts.en:
Leonor is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 4” (The Good Union 4). They are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. They sell mainly in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Leonor makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children. She enjoys attending church.

Leonor has sold shoes for about 5 years. She started the business with money she had saved. Leonor became a Esperanza Internacional client because she wanted to grow her business, but she lacked the capital to do so.

Leonor is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous two loans satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business’s growth. She will use this new loan to buy more shoes and will use the profits to save for her family’s future. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Karla Patricia de 35 años q uien se dedica al comercio de repostería, cosa de horno, arroz de leche, pilloquinto…etc. Este es un negocio familiar que con su esfuerzo y labor ha sacado adelante. 
El crédito lo invertirá en reforzar su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de productos
Las otras integrantes son Marta de 38 años quien vende repostería y cosa de horno y Ana de 40 años se dedica al comercio de cosa de horno (ella las realiza y vende) desde hace 8 años.
texts.en: The Santa Ana Group is composed of three hard working and entrepreneurial women. The group's coordinator is Ms. Karla Patricia, who is 35 years old and sells confections, baked goods, rice pudding, pio quinto [Nicaraguan rum cake], etc. Hers is a family business that, with her work and efforts, has progressed. She will invest the loan money to strengthen her business by buying products in larger quantities. The other group members are Marta, 38, who sells confections and baked goods, and Ana, 40, who has worked with baked goods (she makes them and sells them) for eight years.

loans.use: to buy products in larger quantities

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Rita, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindarle apoyo  en cuanto a sus estudios a su pequeños , doña Rita desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de construcción , lo cual agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva la confianza y la oportunidad de crecer como personas ya que sin estos programas de apoyo no  hubiese un financiamiento para personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en: Rita lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and children. Her plan with respect to her family is to improve their quality of life and to send her little ones to school. Rita has had a private business for several years. The greatest challenge that she faces is that her salary is not enough to make a one-time purchase of construction materials. She is thankful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) funded through Kiva for the trust and opportunity to grow as individuals. Without these support programs there would be no loans accessible to individuals of limited resources.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Matilde Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora MatilD. llegó a la ciudad hace 6 años procedentes D. Aracataca, municipio del departamento del Magdalena donD. se dedicaba al negocio D. restaurante, D. ahí su vasta experiencia en la preparación D. alimentos;  la señora MatilD. es viuda y vive en casa D. una hija que resiD. en Aracataca y quien tiene a cargo su restaurante en esa población, mientras la señora MatilD. tiene un negocio D. comidas rápidas, donD. venD. perros calientes, hamburguesas, fritos y chichas, actividad que desarrolla en horas D. la mañana en el barrio los robles del municipio D. Soledad, en el departamento del Atlántico  en un  local arrendado y en la tarD. funciona en Malambo otro municipio D. este mismo departamento.  
El negocio D. la señora MatilD. presenta poco capital D. trabajo,  ya que sus ventas en general son D. contado y maneja pocos inventarios D. materias primas e insumos, pero sus  compras las  realiza a diario en graneros.  Su meta es incrementar su capital D. trabajo para comprar  en mayor cantidad y ganar descuentos por volumen, que finalmente incrementarán su rentabilidad. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materias primas como arroz, azúcar, saborizantes, salchichas, salsas, azúcar, pan/perro, pan/hamburguesa, verduras, carnes y aceites, compra  que le permitirá también,  disminuir los costos  D. transporte.
texts.en:
MatilD. arrived in this city six years ago from Aracataca, a town in Magdalena department where she worked in the restaurant business.  That is where she gained her vast experience in preparing food.  MatilD. is a widow and lives in the home of one of daughters in Aracataca.  Her daughter runs a restaurant in that town.  MatilD. has a fast food business where she sells hot dogs, burgers, fries and 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She carries out her business in the mornings in the Los Robles neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, in Atlántico department.  She works in rented premises.  In the afternoons, she works in Malambo, another town in the same department.

MatilD.'s business has little working capital since her sales are generally carried out in cash and she has little inventory of raw materials and supplies.  She makes her purchases daily in grocery stores.  MatilD.'s goal is to increase her working capital so that she can buy her products in greater quantities and gain discounts for buying in bulk.  This will increase her profitability.  For this reason, she is applying for this Kiva loan which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials such as rice, sugar, flavorings, sausages, sauces, sugar, bread (hot dogs), bread (burgers) vegetables, meat and oils.  This purchase will also enable her to reduce her transport costs.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, flavorings, sausages, sauces, sugar, bread (hot dogs), bread (burgers), vegetables, meat and oil

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa , es habitante del municipio  de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , doña Josefa desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las alzas de productos , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que con ello logro ampliar su negocio  antes solo vendía frutas y verduras y ahora se amplió a vender comida rápida , golosinas , gaseosa , etec.
texts.en: Josefa lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and children. Her plan for the future is to provide them with a better quality of life. Josefa has been a merchant for several years. Her greatest challenge is the increase in the price of products. She is thankful for the support provided by Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) funded through Kiva. It was with their help that she managed to expand her business. Previously she only sold fruits and vegetables and now she also sells fast foods, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Nelson Enrrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y terminar de construir su humilde vivienda, don Nelson desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de pollo y embutidos, la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder tener un inventario y así abastecer a todos sus clientes. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva;  ya que con este financiamiento podrá invertir más, al igual que su ingresos van hacer un poco más agradable porque entre mas ventas más ingresos podrá optar y a si poder pagar en tiempo y forma.
texts.en: Nelson lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. His plan for the future is to improve their quality of life and to finish building their humble home. For several years Nelson has been selling chicken and sausages. The greatest challenge which he faces is that he does not have sufficient capital funds to hold an inventory in order to satisfy his clients. He is thankful for the support provided by Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) funded through Kiva. With the help of this loan he will be able to invest more and as a result his earnings will be better. With an increase in sales he will earn more revenue and he will be able to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and sausages for resale.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es: A mediados del año 2008 Karina decidió emprender su aventura representada en un negocio, mediante el cual prepara refrigerios, almuerzos y comidas que vende a crédito y de contado a una clientela  de empleados ya conocida y también a los vecinos de su barrio, quienes la  identifican por los deliciosos alimentos que prepara con una gran  dedicación.  Su negocio fue motivado  por el deseo de apoyar  a su familia en los gastos de su hogar y fortalecido porque en su punto de ventas no había competencia alguna, lo cual generó el fortalecimiento de este. En la actualidad Carina se siente muy entusiasmada y desea hacerlo crecer, pero no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo por si sola. Esta es la razón por la cual ha acudido a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos, para la preparación de nuevos menúes  que piensa ofrecer para impactar su mercado con novedades, pues su sueño y gran desafío es convertirlo en un restaurante muy bien posicionado en el mercado objeto de Carina.
texts.en:
In the middle of 2008, Carina decided to start a business preparing snacks, lunches and meals that she sells on credit and for cash to a known customer base of employees and locals from her neighborhood.  She is known by these customers for the delicious food that she prepares with great commitment.  Carina's business was motivated by her desire to support her family with their household expenses.  It was strengthened because there is no competition in her area. 

Carina currently feels very enthusiastic and would like to grow her business but she doesn't have the working capital she needs to achieve this herself.  This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use her loan to buy a larger volume of raw materials and supplies for preparing new meals that she is planning to offer her customers in order to make an impact on her market with new offerings.  Her dream and her biggest challenge is to turn her business into a restaurant which is very well positioned within her target market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for making new meals in larger volumes

loans.name: Ramiro Arnulfo

texts.es: Ramiro trabajador, casado, hijos estudian, meta que sus hijos alcance prepararse, trabajo por cuenta propia, tiene un gran trayectoria en el medio del transporte. Lo inicio con fondo propio y tiene planes de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa también expandir su negocio con la compra de otro bien vehicular para obtener mayores utilidades. El préstamo solicitado será para darle mantenimiento al vehículo mediante reparaciones de algunos repuestos.
texts.en: Ramiro is a hardworking man who is married, and his children attend school. His goal is to see his children complete their schooling and for them to work for themselves. He has a great deal of experience in the field of transportation. He started out with his own funds. He has plans to improve the infrastructure of their house and to expand his business by purchasing another car to increase his income. The loan which he requested will be used to provide maintenance to his car, especially in the form of repairs and the purchase of some spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura madre soltera, sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, toda su vida ha trabajado siendo que a la actualidad tiene su negocio de venta de ropa con ayuda de su hijos ella lleva su negocio hacer un ingreso mas al hogar. Desde un tiempo lo inicio con fondo de micro crédito. Unas de sus metas son el aumento de las ventas con la variedad de nuevos productos. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería de ropas para dama, caballero y niños, artículos de belleza,  zapatos entre otros. Logrando obtener las utilidades presupuestara. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en: Rosaura is a single mother and her children help her financially. She has worked all of her life and today she has a clothing business. With the help of her children she advances with her business to have an additional source of income for the household. She started out with a small business loan. One of her goals is to increase her sales by adding variety with new products. With this loan she will purchase clothing merchandise for ladies, men, and children, beauty products, shoes, and other items. She will be able to obtain earnings with her budget. She is thankful to the institution for the support in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise for ladies, men, and children, beauty products, and shoes.

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es: Teobaldo es propietario de una unidad de negocios a través de la cual expende carne y  lleva por nombre: "Carnes Finas El Establo"; esta actividad fue heredada ya que su padre se dedicó la mayor parte de su vida a ella, su labor la complementa con sus estudios universitarios de contaduria pública. Su negocio nació  despues de trabajar con su padre,con quien logró mucha experiencia y decidió independizarse para emprender su propia aventura hace un año. Con sus ventas mensuales cubre sus costos operativos entre ellos los sueldos de cuatro ayudantes y aporta a los gastos del hogar al igual que su esposa que es contadora y labora en una empresa en la ciudad de Barranquilla, la fortaleza de su negocio es la excelente infraestructura en cuanto a los activos fijos requeridos para su desempeño. Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan con agilidad y su margen de rentabilidad es adecuado para la actividad que realiza. En la actualidad Teoblado está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y le ha entusiasmado la linea de kiva por la tasa de interes que se otorga en ella, porque le ayuda ha ahorrar en sus compras que son de contado y por ser en volumen gana descuentos. Con su credikiva comprará carne de res sobre pedidos. Su meta es ampliar su capital de trabajo para extender el negocio en puntos estratégicos y fortalecer sus ingresos pues planea el desarrollo y crecimiento de su familia en el marco de que su hijo tenga oportunidades de estudio futura que le augure total éxito.
texts.en:
Teobaldo owns a butcher shop called "Carnes Fines El Establo"; his father was also a butcher for most of his life.  He is also studying public accounting at a university.  His business developed after working with his father, where he gained the experience he needed to start his butcher shop a year ago.  His monthly sales cover his operating costs, among them the cost of four assistants and his share of the expenses of the household he shares with his wife, who is an accountant and works in a business in Barranquilla.  The strong point of his business is the excellent infrastructure of the equipment and premises. He keeps his accounts up to date, and his margin of profit is sufficient for his business. 

Teobaldo is currently seeking his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and is very pleased with the Kiva interest rates because the loan will allow him to make bulk purchases using cash so as to get a discount.  He will use the loan to buy beef for which he has orders.  He is working to increase his working capital so that he can expand his business in strategic ways and increase his income in order to plan the development and growth of his family.  He wants his son can have more opportunities to study in the future and succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La señora Georgina es propietaria de la tienda "El Baraton" ubicada en el corregimiento de Juan Mina. Con su  negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con la ayuda de su esposo, quien durante muchos años fue empleado de varias tiendas, pero siempre con la intención de tener algún dia el suyo propio y lo logró despues de unirse con la señora Georgina, cuando incrementó el deseo de independencia y  hace 4 años adquirieron con sus ahorros una pequeña tienda en el municipio de Galapa, en la cual les fue muy bien, pero como  sus planes eran lograr un punto de mayor venta, trasladandose se trasladaron al corregimiento de Juan Mina donde adquierieron la tienda que hoy tienen, compraron la vivienda a crédito pactando un plazo de 5 años para su cancelación total y hasta la fecha solo adeudan los 2 ultimos años. Los estados financieros de su tienda  muestran un margen de utilidad que le permite cubrir todos sus costos y gastos en forma amplia lo que le permite estar reinvirtiendo en el negocio en forma permanente. Sus  inventarios son adecuados para este tipo de negocio y su cartera la maneja con mucha precaución, por eso rota en forma ágil;  Su margen de rentabilidad le permite tener una buena capacidad de pago.  La microempresaria está aplicando a su primer credikiva con el cual  desea en general y tambiem aprovechar las capacitaciones y asesorias que otorga la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en: Georgina owns the store “El Baraton” located in the parish of Juan Mina.  With her business, she has managed to get her family ahead. This is also  with the help of her husband, who for many years was employed at various stores, but always with the intention of one day having his own. He achieved it after uniting with Georgina, when his desire for independence increased. Four years ago they used their savings to acquire a small store in the municipality of Galapa, which went well for them. However, since their plans were to achieve a bigger sales point, they moved to the parish of Juan Mina, where they acquired the store that they have today.  They bought the house on credit, agreeing to a term of 5 years to make the complete payment. To date, they only owe the last two years.  The financial state of the store shows the profit margin that allows them to easily cover their costs and expenses, which allows them to permanently reinvest in their business. Her inventory is adequate for this type of business and since she manages her cash flow with caution, her product turnover runs smoothly. Her profit margin allows her to have a good capacity to pay. The micro-entrepreneur is requesting her first loan, which she wants in general, and also to take advantage of the trainings and support that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation provides.

loans.use: to buy in greater bulk and of a certain variety, including food stuffs.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Yessenia casada,  sus hijos estudia, sus planes que se profesionalicen sus hijos para un mejor futuro, junto a su esposo ha logrado iniciar su propio negocio,  iniciaron desde hace un tiempo con fondos de micro crédito, proyecto agrandar el negocio mediante la compra de mercadería: clavos, pegas de madera, tubos pvc, alambre, cinta de tapagoteras, candados, reglones de maderas, entre otros productos de herramientas para reparaciones del hogar. Agradece a la financiera por el gran apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en: Yessenia is married and her children are in school. Her plans are for her children to have careers for a better future. Together with her husband, she has been able to start out her own business. They started out some time ago with a small business loan. Their goal is to expand their business with the purchase of merchandise: nails, wood glue, PVC tubing, wire, plumber's tape, locks, wooden screeds, and tools used in the home. She is thankful to the financial institution for their great support in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase nails, wood glue, PVC tubing, wire, plumber's tape, locks, wooden screeds, and tools used in the home

loans.name: Emérita

texts.es: Emérita de 54 años de edad vive en el barrio San Salvador de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  en compañía de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 21 y 33.  Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía especialmente ropa, bolsos, accesorios sabanas y jeans, que inició hace 6 años, cuando tomó un ahorro para comprar productos y venderlos a crédito otorgando los plazos acordados con sus clientes. A Emérita le ha ido muy bien con su negocio, ella con sus utilidades logró construir dos apartamentos,  que ahora forman parte de sus ingresos pues se encuentran en calidad de arrendamiento. En su cartera maneja aproximadamente 200 clientes fijos y cada día se esmera por encontrar nuevos y rentables,  que le apoyen el crecimiento de sus ingresos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el  comprará en mayor cuantía y de contado, bolsos, accesorios y diversificará con prendas de plata, mercancías  que son muy rentables y ya tiene un pedido importante. Su meta más adelante es tener un nuevo  vehículo, por eso se esmera por aumentar cada día mas su rentabilidad que es no menor del 51%
texts.en: Emérita is 54 years old and lives in the San Salvador neighborhood in the city of Baranquilla. She lives with her husband and they have two children who are 21 and 33 years old. She sells merchandise, especially clothing, bags, accessories, sheets and jeans. Six years ago, she started by using savings to buy products that she then sold on credit, offering her customers agreed-upon terms of repayment. Emérita's business has been doing very well. With her profits, she has managed to build two apartments that are now part of her income because she rents them out. She has approximately 200 regular clients in her portfolio, and each day she strives to find new and profitable ones to support the growth of her income. This "credikiva" is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy greater quantities and to pay cash for bags and accessories, as well as to diversify with silver pieces. These are are a very profitable type of merchandise for which she already has an important order. Her furthest goal is to have a new vehicle, which is why she strives each day to improve her profitability, which is never less than 51%.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities and to pay cash for bags and accessories, as well as to diversify with silver pieces

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es: Mirna madre soltera, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, sus hijos ya mayores le ayudan económicamente, tiene su negocio desde hace un tiempo lo inicio con fondo de micro crédito, se le presenta dificultades con algunos clientes que pagan a tiempo por algún problema personales. Pero aun con esas dificultades a logrado mantener su negocio, el proyecto que incremente el negocio con el apoyo de su hija. El préstamo comprara mercadería como: ropa para dama, caballero, niños, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería entre otros de necesidad para los clientes.  Gracias a la institución por el apoyo para que tenga su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mirna is a single mother and she is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her children are adults and their help her financially. She has had her business for some time and she started out with a small business loan. She is faced with difficulties with some clients that do not pay on time for personal problems. But despite these difficulties she has managed to maintain her business. Her goal is to expand her business with the help of her daughter. With this loan she will purchase merchandise, such as: clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, shoes, perfumes, jewelry, and other merchandise which her clients need. She is thankful to the institution for their support. Her family is able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, shoes, perfumes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Embajadores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Odania lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She is the coordinator of her group, Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors 1 & 2"). The group is made up of Haitian members, all of them who emigrated from Haiti during different periods. Odania's story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where sugarcane and the tourist industry dominate the economy.

Odania sells clothes such as jeans, shirts, skirts, underwear and other things for kids, women and men. She is excited to be seeking her eighth loan with Esperanza; notably, she has successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to grow her business. With each of these loans she has been able to expand her business by introducing new products.

Odania plans to use this loan to invest in her business and invest the profits in more merchandise. She will save some money to achieve her future plans for her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: Alicia trabajadora, emprendedora, madre soltera, ya sus hijos son independiente le ayudan en el negocio, es comerciante de muebles desde hace un tiempo iniciándolo con fondo de micro crédito en pequeñas cantidades, actualmente ha crecido siendo un gran recurso de ingreso para el hogar. El proyecto y necesidad es la construcción del sumidero. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, piedras cantera, hierro entre otros materiales. Obteniendo mayor comodidad y evitando enfermedades a la comunidad.
texts.en: Alicia is hardworking, enterprising, and she is a single mother. Her children are independent and they help her with the business. She has been a furniture merchant for some time, having started out with a small business loan disbursed in small portions. The business has increased and it is a great source of income for the household. Her goal and need is to build septic tank. With the loan she will purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, construction blocks, quarry stones, steel, and other materials. She will acquire greater comfort and it will prevent communicable diseases.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, construction blocks, quarry stones, and steel.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José es un joven D. 26 años D. edad, que  tiene un negocio mediante el cual venD. helados en un vehículo que circuL. por las calles D. L. ciudad  y que lleva por nombre “Helados Yiuleima” . Él  vive con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades D. 1, a 11 años, con quienes sueña verlos prósperos después D. haberles brindado una educación D. calidad y en esto invierte todos sus esfuerzos.
Su negocio nació hace dos años motivado por su padre, quien también se dedica a esta actividad hace más D. 5 años. Cuando José inició invirtió en un triciclo y se lo dio a su hermano para que empezara en L. venta, como se dio cuenta que el negoció le había resultado, fabricó dos triciclos mas, puso dos vendedores y luego agregó el suyo también. Actualmente venD. en toda L. playa y los dos vendedores en  un  corregimiento cercano  y en algunos barrios D. sus alrededores. Aproximadamente cuenta con 1500 clientes, trabaja desD. las 2:00 p.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y dos D. sus hijos, pues los otros 3 viven con su madre y abueL.. A José le gusta mucho su trabajo por eso quiere ampliar su cobertura, está muy felíz porque cuenta con el apoyo D. su familia y su hermano también se dedica a esta actividad. En su infraestructura cuenta con dos congeladores ubicados en L. casa D. su madre,  donD. almacena el producto. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el tendrá un capital D. trabajo disponible para hacer las compras D. sus helados y planea con su credikiva reemplazar pasivos costosos, lo cual permitiría un crecimiento rápido del mismo.
texts.en:
José is a young man of 26 who owns a business selling ice cream from a vehicle that goes round the streets of the city.  The business is called "Yiuleima Ice cream."  He lives with his wife; they have 5 children aged between 1 and 11 years.  He dreams of seeing them prosper after having been given a quality education, and it is into this that he puts all his efforts.

His business was born two years ago, prompted by his father who has also been working in this line of business for over 5 years.  When José started, he invested in a tricycle and gave it to his brother so he could start selling.  As he realized the business that had resulted from this, he maD. two more tricycles.  He hired two salespeople, and later added himself as well.  Currently he sells throughout the beach and the two salespeople sell in a nearby township and some surrounding neighborhoods.  He has approximately 1500 customers, and he works from 2:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. He lives in his own home with two of his children, as the other three live with their mother and grandmother. 

He lives in his own home with his spouse and two of his children.  José loves his work, so wants to expand his coverage.  He is very happy because he has the support of his family and his brother also works in this business.  His infrastructure is two freezers located in his mother's house, where he stores the product.  His Kiva loan is the first financing that he has done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, he will have working capital available to make purchases of ice cream, and he plans to use his Kiva loan to replace expensive financial liabilities.  These actions will allow rapid growth of the business.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and to replace expensive financial liabilities.

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.es: Judith de 44 años es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 25 años.  Ella vive en la ciudad e Barraquilla donde emprendió su negocio de peluquería y servicios de bellezas desde el año 2000, una vez se preparó en una academia para este propósito. 	Ella inicialmente prestaba el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen de sus amigas a través del corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure  y peinados en su propia casa.  Con el tiempo las personas que una vez accedieron a sus servicios empezaron por volver a buscarla y posteriormente y hasta la presente le envían  muchos referidos y por eso ella permanece en actividad todo el tiempo.  Su trabajo es su máxima motivación porque a ella le encanta, especialmente la línea de maquillaje en la que se desempeña muy bien. Sus hijos, ahora profesionales,   trabajan y su esposo siempre están apoyándola en sus gastos, pues  mantienen una excelente unidad familiar.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un espejo, una silla de peluquería y un lava cabezas, con ello sus clientes se sentirán más confortables y esto es lo que ella busca.  En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad del 60%, que planea aumentar en la medida en que diversifique su oferta con nuevos servicios que en un futuro planea contratar.
texts.en: Judith, 44, is married and has three children between 16 and 25 years old.  She lives in Barranquilla, where she has had a hairdresser and beauty salon since 2000, when she graduated from a beauty academy.  She initially did haircuts, manicures, pedicures, and styling for her friends from home.  Over time, people began to seek her out, and, through word of mouth, she built up a full-time business. She loves her line of work, especially the make-up, which is her strong point.  Both her children, now working professionals, and her husband always help her with expenses, as they are a close family. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair-washing basin.  This will make her clients more comfortable.  She has a profit margin of 60%, which she hopes to increase as she diversifies her offerings with new services in the future.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair washing basin.

loans.name: Luz Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señorita. Luz es socia del banco comunal Las Américas, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe que es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca y otros han migrado a otros países en busca de mejores oportunidades.

La Señorita Luz tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá a quien le ayuda  económicamente. Su mamá es una profesional en la costura y labora en su casa, la casa en la que habita es de su madre.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de Herbalife, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, también se dedica desde muy pequeña a ayudarle a su madre en los trabajos de costura.
  
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Herbalife y también para el arreglo de una maquina de coser.
 
Su meta es ser mayorista en la venta de productos Herbalife.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the 'Las Américas' community bank.  She lives in Cumbe parish which has a cold climate.  The locals work in commerce, raising animals and many people also work in the city of Cuenca.  Others have migrated to other countries in search of better opportunities.

Luz is 30 years old, single, and lives with her mom who she helps out financially.  Her mom is a sewing professional and works from home.  The house in which Luz lives belongs to her mother.

Our client sells Herbalife natural products.  She has been in this business for four years.  She has also been helping her mother with her sewing work since she was very young.

This is Luz's second loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest some of her loan money in buying Herbalife products and some in fixing a sewing machine.

Luz's goal is to become a wholesaler of Herbalife products.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products and to fix a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beer in larger quantities and ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Américas, vive por el Sector de Tutuplai Chico lugar que cuenta con grandes lugares verdes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus primeros 4 hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Rosa se dedica a la limpieza de casas, esta actividad la desempeña desde que tenía 10 años de edad. En su casa se dedica a la cría de vacas, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de toda clase de víveres ya que va a poner una tienda de comestibles en su casa.

Su meta sacar adelante  su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Las Américas Communal Bank.  She lives in the Tutupali Chico Sector, an area with an abundance of verdant lands and nature.  Its people work in agriculture and raise animals, Many go to the city of Cuenca to work in various jobs.  

Rosa is 41 years old, married, and has 6 children- ages 20,18,16,14,13, and 10.  Her oldest 4 children work and help her financially.  Her two youngest attend the neighborhood school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Working together as husband and wife, they have built their own home.  

Rosa cleans houses, a job she has been doing since the age of 10.  At her home, she raises cows, pigs, hens, and guinea pigs for consumption as well as for sale.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of all types of food as she is going to set up a grocery store in her home.  Her goal is to start up her store

loans.use: to purchase general foods.

loans.name: Carmen Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Las Américas, vive por la parroquia La Victoria del Portete,  esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca y  otros han migrado a otros países en busca de mejores oportunidades.

Doña Carmen  tiene 53 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 6 hijos de 33, 32, 30, 24, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su penúltimo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo esta en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia ya que vive en una casa de donde trabaja.

La Señora Carmen labora cuidando una hacienda, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años. También se dedica a la cría de ganado.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción ya que va a comenzar a constrir su casa.
 
Su meta es  terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is a member of the Las Américas community bank, and she lives in the parish of La Victoria del Portete.  This parish has a cold climate, and its people work in trade and animal husbandry.  Many of the parish's people work in the city of Cuenca, and others have migrated to other countries in search of better opportunities.

Doña Carmen is 53 years old.  She lives with her husband and has conceived 6 children who are 33, 32, 30, 24, 12 and 10 years old.  Her eldest four children work and help her financially, her youngest but one child is studying in junior college and her youngest child is in a small school in the city.  Her husband works in construction.  They don't have their own home, so they live in a house where he is working.

Señora Carmen works tending a farm, an activity she has been performing for 10 years. She also works raising cattle.  This is her second loan made ​​through the community bank and she will invest it in the purchase of building materials so that they can start building their home.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cooler, a stove and products like rice, cooking oil, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Grupo Salvador (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Grupo Salvador. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Una de las socias es a la señora Patricia, ella tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y las menores en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
 
Nuestra amiga es muy emprendedora ella es dueña de dos tiendas de comestibles,  una tiene en la casa que pudo construir con mucho esfuerzo y la otra en la casa de su hermana que vive en España y le dio para que se la cuide. Su suegra es quien  administra una de las tiendas mientras que ella se encarga de la otra. Nos cuenta que sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados y los fines de semana, que lleva cerca de 10 años con su negocio y que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo construir su casa y mejorar su vida.

Este crédito es para surtir aun más sus tiendas, va a comprar víveres en general ya que le gusta tener de todo para que sus clientes la prefieran. Este es primer ciclo en el banco y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus negocios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the members of the Grupo Salvador Community Bank meet every two weeks.  These members work in various activities such as general trading and services, among other things. They combined their efforts to be able to gain access to the benefits provided by the Fundación Espoir.  This is their first lending cycle through the community bank and they expect to do very well so as to move forward with the institution.

One of the members is Señora Patricia.  She is 38 years old and married, and from this relationship has three children aged 14, 10 and 7.  The eldest is studying in secondary school and the two youngest in primary school.  Her husband is a security guard.

Our friend is very enterprising; she manages two grocery stores.  One is in her house, which was built with great effort, and the other is in the house of her sister, who lives in Spain and gave it to her to look after.  Her mother-in-law runs one of the stores while she takes care of the other.  She tells us that her children help her when they aren't busy and on weekends.   She's had about 10 years with her business and thanks to her efforts was able to build her home and improve her life.

This loan is to stock up her stores even more; she is going to buy general food supplies as she likes to have everything that her customers prefer.  This is her first lending cycle through the bank and she likes the ease of getting the loans.

Her dreams are to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy general food supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sardines, and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio D. Soledad y  tien 6 maquinaas D. lavar, que ofrece en condiciones D. arrendamiento y con las cuales genera ingresos que sirven para apoyar la gestiòn D. su hogar; este servicio lo ofrece adiariamente D. contado la comunidad D. su barrio y en general D. una gran parte del sector, especialmente a las amas D. casa, a quienes les envia la màquina cuando la solicitan, transportadas en una carretilla. El promedio D. ventas es D. 900 horas D. alquiler mensualmente  y presenta un muy bajo nivel D. cuentas por cobrar. Su negocio presenta una buena autonomia financiera lo cual le permite cubrir futuras obligaciones. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con el cual harà mantenimiento preventivo D. sus maquinas, para continuar en el negocio sin ningun contratiempo, por cuenta D. daños en alguna D. ellas.  Su sueño es aumentar su capital D. trabajo y el volumen D. servicios por eso mas adelante planea adquirir un numero superior D. ellas, mediante el trabajo persistente y disciplinado que caracterizan a Olga.
texts.en:
Olga is a very hardworking woman who lives in the town of Soledad.  She has 6 washing machines which she rents out, and with which she generates revenue used to support her household.  This service is provided on a daily basis to her community in the neighborhood and in general to much of the area, especially to housewives.  She sends the machine to them when requested, transported in a wheelbarrow.  

Her average sales are for 900 hours of monthly rentals, and she has a very low level of accounts receivable.  Her business has good financial autonomy which allows it to cover future obligations.  Her Kiva loan is her first financing; with it she will do preventive maintenance on her machines so as to continue in business without the hitch that could be caused by damage to any of them.  Her dream is to increase her working capital and the volume of service, so she plans to acquire a greater number of machines later on.  This will be through the persistent and disciplined work that is characteristic of Olga.

loans.use: to do preventative maintenance on her washing machines.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена не замужем, но у нее есть две дочки, которых она очень любит. Елена имеет свой бизнес. 
 
Елена торгует женской джинсовой одеждой: юбки, брюки, шорты, куртки и многим другим. Она с удовольствием работает, так как ей нравится это направление. Торговая точка Елены находится в удачном месте при входе на рынок. Она имеет большую харизму и настойчивость, но в то же время очень добрый человек. Елена намерена развивать свой бизнес и не останавливаться на достигнутом. Она работает, чтобы обеспечить своих детей необходимым.

Елена просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 11,200 гривен на приобретение нового сезонного товара. Она надеется увеличить объем торговли и получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Elena is not married, but has two daughters whom she loves very much. Elena has her own business.
 
Elena sells women's denim clothing: skirts, pants, shorts, jackets and other items. She enjoys her work because she loves what she does. Her vendor location is in a very good spot near the market's entrance. She has a very good charisma and persistence, but is also a very kind person at the same time. Elena plans to develop her business and is not going to stop at what she has already achieved. She is working to provide her children with what they need.

Elena is asking for a loan for 11,200 hrivnas to buy seasonal merchandise. She hopes to increase the sales volume and get an additional profit.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal merchandise: summer skirts, pants, blazers

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина не так давно вышла замуж. Ее супруга зовут Роман. Галина после окончания университета работала менеджером, но уволилась из-за маленькой зарплаты. Галина пошла к своей матери в ритуальный салон, а в последний год  управление этим бизнесом перешло полностью к ней.  Сейчас этой бизнес  является главным доходом семьи. 

Галина трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. Ее бизнес цель: открытие второго собственного магазина с аналогичной продукцией. Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен  на закупку продукции (гробы, таблички, ритуальная одежда) и сырье для изготовления венков. Она сможет увеличить ассортимент, следовательно покупателей станет больше и доход семьи тоже увеличится.
texts.en:
Galina got married not so long ago. Her husband's name is Roman. Galina worked as a manager after graduating from the university, but has left her job because of small wages. She went to work with her mother in the ritual shop and within the last year the business operations were completely transferred to her. Right now this business is the main source of income for the family.

Galina is hardworking and purposeful. Her business goal is to open a second location with similar products. Galina is asking to give her a loan in the amount of 20,000 hrivnas to buy products (coffins, name plates, ritual clothing) and raw materials for making of wreaths. She can increase the variety and so the customer base will increase too as well as the income for the family.

loans.use: to buy materials for wreath making as well as other ritual products

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 27-year-old woman and a mother for three young children. Suha and her husband  Alaa Aldeen, are trying their best to provide their kids a restful life in the future, so Alaa Aldeen started working in two jobs and Suha decided to work from her home selling cosmetics products.

It has been two years now since Suha started her small business to help her husband, selling cosmetics products such as make-up, but now she is applying for a loan to add more types of cosmetics and perfumes, in order for her to open a special cosmetics store to cover a wider area.

Since Suha is a conservative person, her husband Alaa Aldeen has agreed to be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To add perfumes to the cosmetics products that she sells.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia, 59 years old, is married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. Aside from this she is also engaged in raising hogs. Evelia has had this retail shop for ten years and her hog business for five years. Each month she earns about 4,000 PHP in her retail shop and 2,500 PHP in her hog raising business.

Evelia is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase bread, soft drinks, sugar, snacks, canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap and coffee for her shop. In the future she hopes to grow her businesses so that she can increase her profits and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, sugar, snacks, canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap and coffee for her shop.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two daughters from Bani Kenanah, a community in the city of Irbid, Jordan.

Mohannad has a small shop where he sells new and used clothing for men, women and children of all ages. Mohannad also sells school supplies including pens, pencils, paper and backpacks along with caps, scarves and different styles of shoes and work boots. 

Mohannad was the youngest son of a large, poor family; hence,  Mohannad grew up knowing the value of "second-hand" clothing, given that what his brothers wore would become his own as he graduated into their sizes. Mohannad also learned the importance of education and hard work; he dropped out of school after the sixth grade to start working and contribute to the family income.

Mohannad has developed his business for the past three years; now, he is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to expand his retail capacity by purchasing some display racks and more clothing. 

Mohannad is looking to a brighter future for his two daughters, his wife and himself. Someday, he would like to open a second shop; but, for now, Mohannad is trying to increase his income by offering his customers a larger selection. As his daughters grow into young women, Mohannad is saving to give them higher education and more choices than he had as a young boy raised in poverty.

loans.use: to purchase some display racks and more clothing.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a single mother and she is 45 years old. She is currently residing at Garit Norte, Echague. Angela has had a food selling business for four years. She is thankful because she is able to provide for the needs of her children. Angela is very responsible mother to her children and up to this moment she is doing her best to improve their standard of living.

Angela would like to access a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional meat to sell such as pork, chicken and hotdogs. She hopes that she can access this loan amount to be able to sustain the needs of her family and maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat such as pork, chicken and hotdogs to sell.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 44-year-old housewife, who started her own business seven years ago at home selling beauty products and cosmetics.

Sameera started small, selling limited types of beauty products until she began to make some profit that allowed her to buy other brands and kinds of cosmetics; she even added accessories to the products she sells.

Now Sameera has applied for this loan to add new types of cosmetics material and perfumes and to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.use: To add new types of cosmetics material and perfumes and to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.name: 18 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mận has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Mận is 53 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 18 Đông Sơn  solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Mận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Mận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mận hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: 6 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Ms Anh is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a genaral store selling household furniture. Anh is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 6 Đông Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

This is Anh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 
She has been involved in this business for more than 5 years
The main hardship that Anh faces in her business is the lack of capital.
 
With her business profit, Anh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell in the general store selling household furniture

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 27-year-old housewife who has three children to raise with her husband Ibrahim.

Ibrahim has a full-time job working at one of the governmental entities in Jordan, but that was not enough income for the family, so he and Dalal decided to start a trading business, selling birds at home on their roof.

Now, as a way to support her husband Dalal decided to take a loan to buy other kinds of birds and to improve the living area and the environment where the birds are kept. 

Since Dalal is a conservative person, she requested that her husband be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy other kinds of birds and to improve the living area and the environment where the birds are kept.

loans.name: Rozan

texts.en:
Rozan is a 20-year-old lady who opened a beauty salon two years ago with the support of her husband and after getting lots of training courses to be a hair and make-up stylist.

Although she started at a young age, her talent, ambition and her hard work have led her salon to be one of the successful beauty salons in the area. 

Now Rozan has applied for a loan to add manicure (nail polishing) as one of her new services, so she wants to buy equipment needed to achieve her purpose.

loans.use: To buy nail polishing equipment so she can add this service to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dios Bendice 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Jesimena is the group representative. She is the coordinator of the group "Dios Bendice 1 & 2" (God Bless). The group is located in La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industries dominate the economy. Jesimena and other members are Haitian emigrants. She has lived in the same community for many years and, for her entire life, she has been living day-to-day without a steady income. She is excited to be doing something different and is ready to make a change and begin to better her life. She hopes to help her children out of their poverty some day as well.

Jesimena plans to invest in her comedor (small restaurant in her neighborhood) by buying rice, beans, flour, oil, vegetables and meats. She cooks a daily lunch for different people in her community or employers and dreams of having a big restaurant in the nearest town. She will use her business profits to make structural changes in her business by buying new chairs, tables, re-painting and many other things.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge, 42 years of age, is single and a father of 3. He's engaged in a livestock business, particularly hog-raising. He's been in this business for almost 6 years. He also has a rice mill. His net income every three months is 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise. He is glad that his business income is now enough to support his children's education. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some hogs to raise

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is a married woman with two children. She is 58 years old and has had a "buy and sell" business for 30 years. Her husband is a farmer.
