Adelfa sells items like vegetables and nipa (palm fronds) to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as nipa.

In the future, she hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as nipa (palm fronds).

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина находится в счастливом браке уже многие годы. У нее двое взрослых детей.

Галина имеет свой бизнес: торгует на рынке платками, шарфами, шапками и купальниками в сезон.  Она с удовольствием занимается именно этим направлением и всегда торгует только качественными вещами. Галина жизнерадостная и приятна в общении. Прибыль тратит на свою семью и помогает детям и внукам. 

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на приобретение купальников для летнего сезона. Увеличение ассортимента привлечет новых клиентов и увеличит доход семьи.
texts.en:
Galina has been happily married for many years. She has two grown-up children. Galina has her own business: she sells shawls, scarves, hats and swimwear in season at the market. She enjoys this type of work and always sells only quality items. Galina is a cheerful and friendly person. She spends her income on her family, helping out her children and grandchildren.

Galina is applying for a loan of 20,000 UAH in order to buy swimwear for the summer season. Expanding her stock will attract new customers and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to increase her stock of swimwear

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en: Aguida is a married woman with two children. She is 51 years old and has had a sari sari (variety) store business for a year. Aguida sells items like vinegar, instant noodles. and shampoo. She usually earns about 1,000 PHP per month and hopes to improve her earnings. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles and daily use products. In the future, she hopes to rebuild her house and have her children finish schooling.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles and daily use products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 55 year-old married woman with two children. The oldest child is 21. She has been raising hogs for 5 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP. In the future, she would like to become more successful.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig food

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina is a married woman with two children. She is 25 years old and has had a buy-and-sell business for a year. Charina sells dried fish and also cooks meals to sell. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients and more dried fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to have enough capital for her business and have her children graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a married woman with four children. She is 50 years old and has been an AVON dealer for a year. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him till the land where they grow rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Diosdada is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and products to sell. In the future, she hopes to help her family live in harmony and be able to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a married woman with two children. She is 59 years old and has had a buy-and-sell business for 20 years. Juana sells items like nipa — a palm used for thatching or making baskets. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to buy more nipa to sell. In the future, she hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is a married woman with 1 child. She is 44 years old. Her husband is a farmer. 

Melva has had a business of selling herbal products and cosmetics for 11 years. She sells items like shampoo, lotion, liniment, and perfume to the people in her community. She also helps her husband sell his harvest at the market.

Melva is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as shampoo and lotion. In the future, she hopes to be successful and receive more blessings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo and lotion.

loans.name: Nestie

texts.en:
Nestie is a married woman with 1 child. She is 24 years old. 

Nestie has had a sari sari store business for 3 years. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and chips to the people in her community. She usually earns about 9,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods.

In the future, Nestie hopes to pursue her studies and to get a degree.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 24 years old and has a 5-year old child. She has had a sari sari store business for 5 years.

Rona sells items like coffee, spices and soft drinks to the people in her community. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as eggs, sugar, vinegar and other daily use products.

In the future, Rona hopes to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, sugar, vinegar and other daily use products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with 3 children. She is 55 years old and runs a business of making coconut wine.

Rosa makes and sells coconut wine to the people in her community. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more tools for harvesting coconuts and other wine ingredients.

In the future, she hopes for her business to improve and to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more tools for harvesting coconuts and wine ingredients.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 37-year-old married woman living in Panglao, Bohol. She runs a motorcycle taxi business and has had this business for 5 years. Glenda works hard to sustain her children’s education. She is asking for a loan of 10000 PHP to renew her motorcycle’s registration and to buy motorcycle spare parts, such as tires. 

Glenda hopes to have better earnings so she can improve her house.

loans.use: to renew her motorcycle’s registration and to buy motorcycle spare parts, like tires.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 4 children. She is 29 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for 4 years.

Jane sells items like detergent soap, vinegar and biscuits. She usually earns about 8000 PHP per month.

Jane is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and other daily use products.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her store. She also hopes to have a higher income so she can sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and shampoo

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 41 years old and is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. She has been engaged in farming for 12 years. Amy primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about 10000 PHP per month from farming.

Amy has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 38 years old and has one son. Analyn is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 9 years now. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. They also earn extra income by transporting passengers to different barangays of Sta. Josefa.

This loan will help Analyn buy the farm supplies she needs like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Analyn hopes to manage a bigger farm and to be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy the farm supplies she needs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 13, 8 and 6. Arlene’s husband works as a farmer.

Arlene is also a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years. Arlene earns enough money by doing this. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Arlene hopes to own a bigger farm and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 39 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Elsie’s husband works as a farmer.

Elsie is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Elsie has been growing rice for 17 years. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Elsie hopes to own a bigger farm and to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, 41 years old, is a married woman with three daughters. The oldest child is 16 and the youngest is only 6.  Elvie and her husband are farmers in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  Elvie has been growing rice for 15 years. Her average income per month is Php 15,000.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  In future, Elvie hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 21 and 19.  Evelyn and her husband are farmers in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  Evelyn has been growing rice for 16 years. Apart from farming, she also ventured into the hog-raising business.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and piglets. Evelyn hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Gerrelyn

texts.en:
Gerrelyn is a married woman with three children.  The oldest child is 18 years old. Gerrelyn and her husband are farmers in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Gerrelyn has been growing rice for 10 years. Her average income is 10500 PHP a month.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.  In the future, Gerrelyn hopes to own a bigger farm and have bigger profit for her family.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 51- year old married woman living in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Guillerma’s husband works as a farmer.

Guillerma has been growing rice for 18 years. She works hard to help her husband sustain their family. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, gasoline for the tractor and to pay for labor.

Guillerma hopes to have her younger children finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, gasoline for the tractor and helps pay for labor

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur.  She has 4 children. 

She is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 20 years.  Like any other mother, she would like to give her children a brighter future. She works hard to sustain her family.  This loan will help her buy the farm supplies she needs, like fertilizer and rice seeds.

In future, Josie hopes to see her children succeed.

loans.use: buy farm supplies like fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 45 years old and has 3 children. 

Lucia and her husband are both farmers. She supports her husband in tilling the land where they grow rice crops. Lucia does her best to keep her family happy and healthy. She requested a loan to fund their farm. She will buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will also use part of the loan to pay for labor.

Lucia hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: pay for labor and to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 35 years of age, married and blessed with 5 children. She is involved in the livestock business, particularly hog-raising. Her net income, every three months, is 7,000 per hog. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional livestock feed for her hogs. She would like to continue receiving loans to grow her business, and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
N. Ketut is 46 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two children. Though N. Ketut often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her F.’s income.

N. Ketut is the head of the Tegal Sari Group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s third loan with MUK. Of the 10 people, N. Ketut will receive 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah. She will purchase three piglets and pig feed with the loan. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork roll. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from raising pigs, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Because fish is reasonably priced, it is the kind of food that most Cambodian people like to buy to cook for their families. 

To make a living, Mrs. Pech sells fish in and around her community, Baray district. She can make a daily income of about $2 (U.S. dollars) from her fresh fish-selling business. Her husband helps support the family by working in agriculture. He also works in construction whenever his job planting rice crops falls to part-time.

Presently, Mrs. Pech owns a bicycle, which she uses to transport her fish to sell. Mrs. Pech faces a problem with traveling long distances, so she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a used motorbike in order to make it easier for her to pick up her fish to sell to communities further away.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for picking up fish to sell to communities long distances away.

loans.name: Chhong

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhong is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of four children, who still attend school locally.

She earns money by selling a few fresh fish, which she gets from her husband fishing on the local river, or other local fisherman. She resells the fish in and around her village, the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. On average, she is able to make about $1.50 (U.S. dollars) per day, which helps with the family's expenses. 

She always uses her old bicycle to deliver her fish to sell. Her bicycle is too old and it moves very slowly. She really wants a used motorcycle but she doesn't have sufficient cash to buy one. That is why Mrs. Chhong is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle, which will she will use to transport her fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport her fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 32 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.
Bevelyn works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested loan for 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Bevelyn has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  variety of fish for sale

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung, 29, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Seoung sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 4 on the other necessary expenses. Seoung is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Kimsron

texts.en: Kimsron, 28, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Kimsron is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.4 per day. Her husband is employed at World Relief Cambodia Organization in the province, earning an income of USD 5.33 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. Kimsron is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family farming. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Euis

texts.en:
Euis is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She has had a business of electronic goods and clothes since 2005, and from its income she could pay for school for her children and even courses outside school hours.

Euis has used her current loan of 4,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to open a new business that sells drinks like coke and snacks like chiki, as well as renting playstations.

Last month from her savings, she could afford for her daughter to marry, and now she wants to invest to be able to have a shop for each of her children to finance their own lives.

loans.use: to pay for drinks like pop, ice and snacks

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. Sum, 53, is a chief of the local police station in Baray district. He has been working at this job since 2005 and has a regular salary. 

His wife breeds pigs in a pigpen behind their house. She raises pigs both for their offspring and for slaughter. The family is able to make around $5.50 a day (U.S. dollars) to cover their financial expenses. The couple has six children, three of whom are already married and who live at their house, and three of whom are single and studying in Phnom Penh City. 

In order enlarge his wife's pig-breeding business and increase profits, Mr. Sum will use the loan to purchase piglets and additional pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and additional pig feed in order to enlarge his wife's business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 47 years of age, is married to a driver and they are blessed with 3 children. 

Marilyn has been growing rice for almost 20 years. She's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides. Last crop, her net income was 30,000 PHP. She would like to continue availing loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunzaya is 32 years old and she lives with her husband and 2 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in their own flat in the center of Darkhan. 

Mrs. Ariunzaya is a teacher of Mathematics in the local secondary school. Her son attends a secondary school and her daughter goes to the local kindergarten. Her husband runs a taxi business, using his family car, carrying passengers between Darkhan and the capital city, which is 220 kilometers away.  On average, he makes one trip per day to the capital city, occasionally two. Mrs. Ariunzaya’s father is a former taxi driver and he is unemployed at the moment. Mrs. Ariunzaya wants to buy an another car to use for the taxi business as well. Her father will act as a taxi driver to earn some extra income for the family. Mrs. Ariunzaya is going to use her family’s savings, but needs some money on top of it to buy a car with lower mileage. 

The loan that Mrs. Ariunzaya is taking will be used to buy the second hand car and to use it for taxi business employing her father and to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a second hand car to use as a taxi business, employing her father and to increase her family’s income.

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Pheoun, 43, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Pheoun sells groceries, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband grows yams to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Pheoun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Nourng

texts.en:
Nourng, 51, is married to Kiev, 52, who is a local farmer in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Nourng has five children: three are single and two are married. Three of her children are employed in different occupations to earn money. 

Nourng is good at making Khmer cake to sell in her village. Besides her own work, Nourng always helps her husband planting and farming rice. She and her husband have over ten years experience in the farming business and they earn about $2.50 (U.S. dollars) a day. 

This is the rainy season and it is the good time for growing crops. However, Nourng doesn’t yet have capital to use on her farm. So Nourng is looking for a loan to use to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to protect her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to protect her crops.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Sreng.  He is 41 years old and is a humble father of three single children who work in various jobs to earn money. 

Since 2000, Sreng has been cultivating rice on the farmland that he inherited from his grandparents in Baray district. Besides the current farm work, he also buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. His wife has built a pigpen behind their house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.   

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for the family, Sreng has requested a loan to assist his wife in her business activity.  He will use the loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Buyan-Nemekh

texts.en:
Buyan-Nemekh is 41 years old and lives with her family in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a cleaner at two companies, while her husband runs a taxi business. In addition, her 17-year-old daughter attends public high school and her son currently has not yet found a job.

Buyan-Nemekh’s small house needs some work to be done on the outside and inside as well. She is requesting a 1,500,000 loan to buy materials such as, cement, bricks, wallpaper, wallpaper paste, vacuum-insulated window and other necessary materials to finish her homebuilding and renovating work. 

Recently, their family bought a 32 Inch LCD television and replaced their car with a better one, with the profits that Buyan-Nemekh’s husband made. Buyan-Nemekh and her husband want to improve their living standards so that their family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to finish fixing up her home.

loans.name: Oteza

texts.en:
Oteza, 43 years old, is married and has been blessed with 4 children. She has been growing rice for almost 20 years. Her net income, last crop, was 35,000 PHP. 

Oteza is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings, manure, and insecticides. She is thankful for having Kiva lenders who generously supported her business, which enables her to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, manure and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Aork

texts.en:
Aork operates a small sewing business from a kiosk in front of her house and also raises piglets to earn income.   She provides her tailoring service to her neighbors and other villagers, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. Her sewing business is running very well and a lot of customers are aware of the good service she provides. 

Aork is widow as her husband died of illness a long time ago.  She lives with her four single children.  Her three other children are married and living in their own houses. She also depends on her two daughters who are employed in a garment factory.  Aork will use half of her loan to buy more tailoring tools and the rest to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: buy sewing tools, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch is a 29-year-old village man who has had a job as a fisherman since he was single. He fishes on the lakes and rivers next to his community. He started this business ten years ago and is earning approximately  $3 a day. His wife is a fish seller. This humble couple has two young children who are not yet enroll in school.   

For this upcoming fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking tools to fish with. Therefore, Uch is applying for a loan to purchase a new boat with a machine to help him catch more fish.

loans.use: buy a new boat

loans.name: Ulziihutag

texts.en:
Ulziihand is 52 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in the Dornod province of Mongolia. She manages a cafe in her town with the help of her husband and daughter. She started her business in 2000 having worked as a cook for several years. Since then her business has been quite successful. This enabled her to buy a house for her family in 2002. She plants a variety of vegetables and flowers in her backyard. Now she employs 5 more workers at her cafe. She is planning to have her own building for her business operations. 

She is a polite and kind woman who possesses good managerial and accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase tables and chairs for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is 41 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. His daughter, aged 9, attends the local secondary school. 

He manages a clothes and household goods trading business, with the help of his wife, from a container at a local market. He started his business in 2000. At first he used to rent a stall. He switched to a container in 2005. His business was quite successful which allowed him to buy a truck. He is a hardworking man who is planning to expand his business. He says, "I want to have better living conditions for my family. Therefore, I am doing my best to make my business flourish." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more stock to sell this coming spring.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her older son, aged 10, goes to a local secondary school while her second son is in kindergarten. Her husband manages a car wash service with his friend. She conducts a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and has gained much experience. She contributes all her earnings to her family's needs. 

She is a polite and kind woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I want to have a plot of land where I can build a house for my family. I hope my dream will come true some day." She is requesting a 3,400,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en:
Khuth has been spending her life cultivating crops in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparent when she was young. Her husband is a craftsman. Two of their children assist him in the business and the other two are still studying in school.  

Khuth will use her loan to buy more equipment to support her husband in his crafts business. Mrs. Khuth and her husband wish to borrow some fund for supporting on their business present. Both of them would like to borrow from KIVA in order to expand on their craft business currently. In the future, she wants to built a big new house than present.

loans.use: to expand on their craft business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 61 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Lydia’s  husband works as a farmer. 

Lydia is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for quite a long time now. Lydia earns enough money by doing this. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Lydia  hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 39 years old, is married to an overseas Filipino worker and is blessed with 1 child. He has been growing rice for almost 10 years. His net income last cropping was 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. He would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva and ASKI to request larger loans so that he can grow his business and earn more income to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The eldest child is 27 and the youngest is 19. Madiore and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till their land where they grow rice crops. She has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Madiore hopes to improve her family's living conditions. She also wishes to see her all her children succeed.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 57 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is single.
Patricia has a boarding house business and earns approximately 10000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase material for her boarding house.
Patricia has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase material for her boarding house

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Marivic has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.
Marivic is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and is a married woman. She has been running a small rice farm since 1996. Her husband is also a farmer.

Merlyn helps her husband till their land. Rice is the primary crop that they grow. According to Merlyn, she earns about 5800 PHP per month.

Merlyn's loan will be used to purchase gasoline for the tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline for the tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chemetet

texts.en:
Chemetet is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. She has been in farming for 10 years, producing milk, maize and tea. All her products are sold at the local market.

Chemetet has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she says Juhudi loans have really made life better for her and hopes with an additional acquisition she will be able to educate her children.

Chemetet says farmers need training and help in finding good breeds to make their farming more profitable, as these are the main challenges especially for dairy farmers.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and is 54 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of groceries. She has had this business for 5 years.

Rufina is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and coffee to sell to her customers. Each month, Rufina earns about PHP3000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rufina hopes that she can maintain her retail shop business so that she can provide for her family and improve her store. Rufina would be thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, softdrinks and coffee to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 
Edgardo is raising piglets to sell. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pigfeed.
Edgardo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edgardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigfeed

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lorena has a retail shop where she sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Lorena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Pioneta

texts.en:
Pioneta is a 50-year-old married woman with one child who is 14 years old. Pioneta and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till the land and grow rice crops. While her husband mainly manages the farm, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells daily use products like shampoo and soap.

Pioneta has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. She hopes for their farm to grow. She also hopes for her family to always be happy.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 32-year-old wife and the mother of three children. She has a full-time job as a school employee. Her husband, Bassam, found that she has artistic talent when it comes to arranging flowers and trees. He decided to work with her on developing this talent by encouraging her to start making flowers using plastic and metal materials. He is in charge of selling what she makes. Now Ibtisam and her husband have opened a flower shop that has been running successfully because of their hard work. Ibtisam has applied for this loan to add  natural flower arrangements to their shop.

Since Ibtisam is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to buy natural flowers and plants for arrangements as a new service at their shop.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Elna has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & breads to resell.

Elna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & breads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 45 years old.  She is married and has 2 adult children.  Rufina has a transportation service business. She has been running this business for 17 years and earns PHP 4,500 a month from this work.

Rufina is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy tires and a sprocket for her motorcycle to maintain the good service she offers in her community.

In the future, Rufina hopes that her business will improve so she can better sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: buy tires and a sprocket for her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Rosa earns a living through farming. She helps her husband grow rice crops and sell their harvests at the market. 

Rosa has applied for a loan to fund their farm operations. She plans to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs with her loan. She will also pay for the labor of other farmers to help till their land.

In the future, Rosa hopes to have her children graduate from college and find appropriate jobs for themselves.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 56 years of age.  He is married and is blessed with 3 children. He has been growing rice for almost 30 years. His net income from the last crop is 35,000 PHP. 

Arsenio is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He felt glad that his business income is now good enough to support his family's daily needs. He would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in his next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of his business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Mylien

texts.en:
Mylien is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mylien has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents & canned goods. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to resell.

Mylien is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 58 years of age.  She is widowed and has 9 children. She has been growing rice for almost 30 years.  From her last crop, she received a net income of 25,000 PHP.

Tita is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings, insecticides, and fertilizers. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: buy seedlings, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with 6 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. Zenaida’s husband works as a farmer.

Zenaida is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice to sell. According to Zenaida, she earns about 10000 PHP per month from farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to manage a bigger farm and earn a bigger profit for her family.

loans.use: purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Frumencio

texts.en:
Frumencio is 45 years of age.  He is married and is blessed with 1 child. He has been growing rice for almost 20 years.  From the last crop, his net income was 30,000 PHP.   

Frumencio is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. He would like to continue availing himself to similar loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 45 years old and is a married man with 3 children.  His oldest child is 20 years old. 

Anecito is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He has been growing rice for 7 years. He earns 3600 PHP per month from this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fuel for his tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to have his children finish their studies.

loans.use: buy fuel and farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old . She is widowed with five adult children. Elizabeth has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, shampoos and soap. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to purchase additional goods for the store.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snacks, shampoos, detergents and more for the store.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 31 years of age.  He is married and is blessed with 2 children. He has been growing rice for almost 5 years.  From his last crop, his net income was 30,000 PHP. 

Jefferson is asking for a loan of 28,000 PHP to purchase additional farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. He hopes that KIVA lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old.  She is a married woman with a 5-year-old child.  Anna is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She helps her husband till their land where they grow rice crops. She would rent a stall at the market to sell their harvests.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Anna hopes to be be successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lorielyn

texts.en:
Lorielyn is 38 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 1 child. She is engaged in a livestock business raising hogs.  Her net income every three months is 25,000 PHP. 

Lorielyn is asking a loan for 35,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her hogs.   She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Riza provides manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials for her  pedicure & manicure service.

Riza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy pedicure & manicure supplies

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: The old woman who appears in the picture is Mrs. Uk.  She is a 58-year-old village woman living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province.  She sells a variety of goods to her community from a wooden store. She has been running this business since 2007, earning an income around $10 each day to cover expenses for her family. Her husband is a horse cart deliverer in the local market. Mrs. Uk has four single children, two of them are students in the local school and the other two are married.  Mrs. Uk would like to request a loan to buy buffaloes for breeding. With the rest of the funds, she will buy extra necessary items to sell in her store.

loans.use: buy buffaloes to breed and items to sell in her store

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 25 years old and is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer and as a driver.

Jeana is a farmer. She helps her husband till their land, which is located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She said they have been growing rice for 5 years. They also own a carabao (water buffalo) that helps in tilling their land.

This loan will be used to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers. In the future, Jeana hopes to have a better life.

loans.use: pay for labor and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Joe

texts.en: Joe, 40 years old, is still single. He has been managing a livestock business, particularly hog-raising, for almost 10 years. His net income every three months is 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for every hog that he sell. He's asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase livestock feeds for his hogs. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support his business to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda  is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Rosalinda  has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more breads, biscuits & canned goods to sell.

Rosalinda  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy breads, biscuits & canned goods

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 35 and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 17 and 15. Jenalyn and her husband are both farmers. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm and she helps him when she can. Jenalyn raises pigs in their backyard. She said that she and her husband work hard to sustain their family. They also both want their children to have bright futures.

Jenalyn has requested a loan to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: buy pig feed, fertilizers, and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 51 years old and lives in Lurugan  Valencia City. She is widowed and has 4 children. 

Cristita has a shop that sells electronic loads of different networks and a general store that sells snacks, canned goods, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc.  She has had this business for 4 years.   Cristita has requested a loan for 5000 to buy additional goods to sell and electronic loads for customer usage.  

Cristita has been a member of HSPFI since just this year.  In the future, she hopes to make her store much bigger and have a more successful business.

loans.use: To buy goods and electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a 43-year-old woman who has two boys and two girls, and she is married to a tourism guide.

Three years ago Nariman wanted to make use of her back yard, so she started planting some cactus and other plants as a decoration for their garden, and then she decided to start with profitable business by selling these plants as shown in the picture, also in her house back yard.

Now Nariman wants to add other kind of plants and after that open her own plant store to show and sell her well decorated plants. So that’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy some seeds and plants that are not available yet in her garden.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 54 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 4 children. Milagros is engaged in a livestock business raising hogs.  Her net income is 5,500 PHP for every hog that she sells every three months.   She is asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Leilyn is 30 years old and is a married woman with a 3-year-old child. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. Her husband is the one who mainly manages their farm.  She helps him grow their rice crops and keep the farm free of weeds and pests.  Leilyn also raises pigs in their small backyard piggery. She does her best to help provide for the needs of their family.

This loan will be used to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. In the future, Leilyn hopes to have a good life and a happy family.

loans.use: buy pig feed, fertilizer and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Dao-On

texts.en:
Dao-on is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Dao-on has a retail shop that sells medicinal food supplements from USANA Foods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional medicinal food supplements.

Dao-on is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Dao-on hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional medicinal food supplements.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng is 40 years old and is a resident of the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province.  She earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy them in bulk at her house. She is married and have four children who are not yet married and are still attending school. Her husband, Tan, earns revenue by cultivating rice crops on his own land. Mrs. Sreng has applied for a $1100 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to pay for ducks and feed which she bought on credit.

loans.use: pay for ducks and feed which she bought on credit

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is 38 years old.  He is married to Grace and they are blessed with two children. He has been operating his spare parts business for the past year. 

He has been loaned KES 80,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to repair his vehicle and purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

He plans to use the profit from his business to add more stock.  In the future, he hopes to open another spare parts shop.

loans.use: purchase car and motorbike spareparts

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Cresencia has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to sell.

Cresencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma  is 31 years old.  She has 3 children and is separated from her husband.

Alma has a shop that sells snacks and basic items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, and more.  She has had this business for 1 year.  Alma has requested a loan for 5,000.00 to buy additional goods to sell.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since this year.  In the future,  she hopes to  improve her  store and make it bigger so she can accommodate  the needs of her village customers.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Jogie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to sell.

Jogie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old single lady. She has rental houses and also sells second-hand clothes, a business she has been running for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000, which she puts back in her business.

Mary has been loaned KES 35,000 by KADET LTD. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to add more stock of second-hand children clothing.   She plans to use the profit from her business to buy a plot and build more rental houses.  In the future, she hopes to have five plots of rental houses.

loans.use: buy second-hand children clothing

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ophelia has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing. Ophelia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Ophelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing rice for more than 20 years. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month with her rice farming. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel for the tractor. In the future, she hopes to have a large rice field and earn better income from the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus is a 54-year-old farmer.  He is married to Bendelina, who is 51 years old. They are blessed with seven children, four of them are working and three have graduated from senior high school but do not yet have jobs. 

Petrus owns a plot of land where he plants rice. He has been working as a farmer since he was young, as he was born into a farming family. Petrus is a keen farmer, he usually starts his activity early in the morning. After harvesting his rice crops, Petrus then utilizes the empty rice field to cultivate corn, kangkung (a leafy vegetable), tomatoes, chilies, mustard greens, etc. 

According to Petrus, latterly his harvest has not been good due to the lack of fertilizer.  This, of course, has an impact on his income. Therefore, he would like to seek capital to start a pig breeding business.  He plans to spend the loan on 2 piglets, fodder and a sack of fertilizer.  

Petrus has submitted a loan application to TLM to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application for his business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets, fodder and fertilizer

loans.name: Cesenia

texts.en:
Cesenia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Cesenia has a retail shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more sacks of rice.

Cesenia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 46 and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 18. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur, where she has been growing rice for 17 years. Mira sells her harvest to rice traders. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family's needs.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. In the future, Mira hopes to be a millionaire.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 49 years old and is married.  He runs a dressmaking business in Mikindani, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last 25 years and has been a success. 

Festus has been a KADET LTD client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase fabric materials and thread.    The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. Festus' dream is to open a fabric materials and thread college.

loans.use: buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Editha has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Editha is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is married to Mr. Sun, 53, who works as a military policeman in the Ministry of the Interior in Battambang Province. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are still attending public school. 

Mrs. Sok, 42, is a fresh fish seller.  She has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for five years. She sells fish that she gets from her wholesale supplier and from fishermen. 

Mrs. Sok is running her fish business well, as she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Sok is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Ruben owns a motorcycle to transport passengers from the village to downtown. He has had this service for two years. He requested a loan of 5,000 to buy needed spare parts, bolts, lights and a tire for the motorcycle.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011. In the future, Ruben hopes to stay longer in this sector and buy another motorcycle for transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, bolts, lights and a tire for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married to Otiende. She has been running her embroidery and secondhand clothes business for 18 years. She earns a monthly income of about 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to stock up for the business and take care of her family.

Mary has been loaned 50,000 KES by KADET Ltd. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more stock materials and secondhand clothes for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business to buy more machines and open a dressmaking school. In the future, she hopes to have a very big boutique with a variety of wears.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery and buy secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Mercedita has a retail shop that sells different kinds of lunch meals as well as canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for 9 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to cook dishes to serve and sell.

Mercedita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients needed to cook meals to sell

loans.name: Mirly

texts.en:
Mirly is 59 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her familiy. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for more than 25 years. She works hard to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Mirly has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes that CEVI and Kiva will continue to support her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old and married. Ammar has had a workshop since 2006. He repairs and sells motorcycles. He has more than five years experience and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

Ammar is requesting a $1800 loan to make showcases, a sliding door and to add more inventory to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make showcases, a sliding door and to add more inventory to his workshop.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 45 years old and is married to Dolores, who is a business-minded woman. The couple is blessed with 4 children and they are grateful because their eldest son is already working. Through their sacrifices, they are able to make their businesses more productive. 

Jaime grows rice and has been doing this for almost 30 years.  He is able to earn about PHP 41,000 from the harvest on his rice farm and his wife earns about PHP 10,000 from her store and welding shop.  Jaime is asking for a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his farm.

In the future, Jaime hopes to increase the profit he generates from his business so that he can sustain the needs of his family and improve their way of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Eney

texts.en:
Eney is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married  and has 2 children. 

Eney  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, soap, noodles and juices. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy for additional stocks to sell.

Eney has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.   In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, canned goods & breads to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, canned goods & breads

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 32 years old and is married to Purity. He owns an electrical hardware shop in Lainisaba where he supplies electrical goods.  He has been running this business for the last five years and earns an income of  KES 20,000 per month.

Douglas was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a KADET client.  He has a good credit history with KADET and is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to open another electrical shop.

Douglas hopes to have a big electrical shop. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: add more stock of electric sockets, bulbs, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 40 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 16, 14 and 9. She and her husband are both farmers. This has been their livelihood for quite some time now.  Myrna helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops. She has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, fuel for the tractor and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes to be a millionaire.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizer & fuel, and pay for labor

loans.name: Cristilita

texts.en:
Cristilita is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Cristilita has a retail shop that sells candies, beverages & breads. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more candies, biscuits & beverages to sell.

Cristilita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy candies, biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 36 years old and single. She has been in farming for 12 years and employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces tea and milk, which are sold to the local market.  She resides in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya.

Evalyn has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the loan will improve her family income, which will be used to repay the loan as well as provide the family with basic needs.

Evalyn says that animal diseases and lack of animal feed are the challenges faced in dairy farming.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 24, is a married woman and the mother of two children, both of whom are still living under her care. Her husband is Poun, 26, a local fisherman. Khim makes a living by selling fresh fish that she gets from her husband. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young.  

To earn more income, Khim’s husband also runs a motor taxi service. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Khim has decided to seek a loan of $400 from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle for husband so he can run his motor taxi service.

loans.use: replace her husband's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 35-year-old  married man. He has owned a water filtering shop since 2003. He worked hard to open his business and has improved it over the years.

Atef's shop is unique in his area because water pollution is a major problem in the region. Service timing and cleanliness are important these days and require a lot of work. He works hard to add new improved quality products and services.

Atef is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy a new car necessary to transport water to his clients' homes and businesses. He hopes to expand his business and become well-known in order to provide a better life for his children in the future.

loans.use: buy a car to deliver water to his clients

loans.name: Irene Mae

texts.en:
Irenne Mae is 20 years old and lives in Impasugong Bukidnon. She is single and has 1 child.  

Irenne Mae has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, soap and more. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase additional rice for wholesale .  

Irenne Mae has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future,  she hopes to have a successful business for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for wholesale

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Iris has a retail shop that sells snacks, candies & biscuits. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages & snacks to sell.

Iris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 32 years old.  She is married to Dominic and they are blessed with two children, ages 12 and 9. She has been running a hair salon for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Salome is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after having successfully repaid the previous loans. Salome will use the new loan to add stock and equipment to her salon: hair pieces, a blow dryer and a water heater. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children up to their comfort level. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open other hair salon branches in different towns, creating a source of employment for society, and to improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy hair pieces, a blow dryer and a water heater

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica  is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She  is married and has 3 children. 

Jessica  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, coffee, drinks and juices. She has had this business for 2 years.  Jessica has requested a loan for PHP 5000 to purchase additional goods to sell so that she can earn a bigger profit to save for family needs.

Jessica  has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for her family.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Elma has a vulcanizing shop that repairs vehicles & motors, with her husband working as the repairman. She has had this business for 11 years. Elma has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the shop.

Elma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools & pay utilities costs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old .  She is married and has 3 children. 

Lorna  has a shop that sells generic medicine and food supplements.  At same time,  she also sells snacks and food products.  She has had this business for 10 years.  Lorna has requested a loan for PHP 5000 to buy additional products to sell.

Lorna  has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her store and make it bigger to accommodate her customers' needs.

loans.use: buy medicine and food supplements

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 32 years old.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She has a retail store where she sells different products to the local community. Juvilyn has had this business for 3 years and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month.

Juvilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell in her store.  In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Racilyn

texts.en:
Racilyn is 30 and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land where they grow rice crops. Racilyn said they earn about 10000 PHP  per month from farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes to earn more income and sustain her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 39-year-old married man and a father of three children. He has owned a furniture shop since 1999. He worked hard to open his business and improve it over this period.

Jamil works hard to improve his works' quality, and he works on marketing them as quickly as possible.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy a machine necessary to improve his business, in addition to a power generator. Electricity is a main issue in the area, and he has to reply to customers' needs as fast as he can.

Jamil hopes to buy the requested machines, in addition to having a special future for his family, children and business.

loans.use: to buy a new machine necessary for his business, in addition to a generator.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 40-year-old business lady and a single mother of three children.  She is a trader of green vegetables and grains. She has been in this  business for the last 17 years and earns an income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Nancy is applying for her sixth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Nancy will use this new loan to add stocks of dry maize and beans, and invest in mixed crop farming.   With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children up to university level. Her hope and dream is to concentrate more on educating her children.

loans.use: buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 28 years old and is still single. He is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He has been growing rice for 5 years. He works hard to improve his business. He also wants to save for his future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. In the future, Rolly hopes to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old.  She  is married  andh as 4 school-age children. 

Marivic has a shop that sells snacks, drinks, canned goods, and more. She has had this business for 5 years.  Marivic has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional goods for her business

Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 37 years old and a teacher, who also opened a book and stationery shop nine years ago to work at after school.

Because of the great location that he got for his stationary shop in front of a very popular school, he had to employ more people to help him serve the students' needs. He also asked his customers what was missing in his shop and in no time provided them with it: children's toys, school bags, certain gifts, etc.

Now Mohammad is applying for a loan to buy another copy machine that is more functional than the older one he has so he can provide the best service in less time.

loans.use: To buy another copy machine for his book and stationery shop.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Mathilde is 56 years old . She is married with 4 adult children.

Mathilde has a shop that sells snacks, candies, spices, oil and canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell like snacks, biscuits, juices, milk, coffee and more.

Mathilde has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011.  In the future, Mathilde hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snacks, drinks, oil and candies to sell

loans.name: Mary Muthoni

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married to Geoffrey. They do not have children yet. She owns a hardware shop in Ruai, Nairobi, where she supplies hardware items to various institutions. She has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of 20,000 KES per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client of KADET. She has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her fourth loan of 78,500 KES from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to buy more iron sheets and nails to supply to a school.

She will use the extra profit to open another shop. Mary hopes to grow her business and, in future, to own a mega hardware shop. She is very hardworking and focused lady.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets and nails to supply to a school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chemicals and hairpieces for the business

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Mrs. Hum is a 58-year-old fish vendor and the mother of two children. She and her family reside in Siem Reap Province. To make a daily income, she always goes to buy fish from the fishermen, and she hurries up and brings her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. Mrs. Hum has a life partner in her husband, who is a boat deliverer and always uses his boat to pick up both domestic tourists and foreign tourists to see the view along the river for fees. One of her kids helps support him in the same business. As his boat is too old, he would like to repair it but he doesn’t have immediate cash. Mrs. Hum is seeking for a Kiva loan for her husband to mend the broken boat.

loans.use: to mend a broken boat for her husband.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old. She is single with 3 school-aged children.
 
Helen has a shop that sells coco wine, snacks, canned goods, noodles and more. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell like coco wine, snack goods, juices, spices and more.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional coco wine and snack goods to sell

loans.name: Girumwete Group

texts.fr:
Annonciate est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite au centre ville de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (riz et haricot) depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle est mariée à Jean-Bosco, un aide-soignant. Ils ont ensemble  3 enfants dont 1 étudie en 4e année des études primaires. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaires.
Son crédit de 100,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats de riz et haricots pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« GIRUMWETE».
texts.en:
Annonciate is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in downtown Gitega. She is a member of the solidarity group GIRUMWETE. She started selling foodstuffs (rice and beans) five years ago, and she is also a farmer. She is married to Jean-Bosco, a caregiver. The couple have three children, one of whom is in the fourth grade of primary school. Annonciate herself attended school up to the fifth grade. 

Her loan of 100,000 Burundian francs will help her to increase her working capital and to bolster her purchases of rice and beans for resale in order to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to bolster her purchases of rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: As everyone knows, fish is the main vital fresh food for everybody, in particular families who depend on fishing and fish-selling. Mr. Meas, one among those people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. He and his wife sell fish that they buy from their wholesale supplier. They are humble parents who have been blessed with six children. One has already married and five are single, of which one works as a domestic construction worker in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. Meas has requested a loan to purchase more fresh fish for selling. Mr. Meas hopes he can increase his net income by using a Kiva loan as an advance.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 31 years old and a blacksmith businessman married to Catherine, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children ages 15, 9 and 4 years old, respectively. He makes things like stoves, cooking pots and pans.  

He has been in this business for the past five years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Boniface will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals to increase his stock.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and live a stable life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metals to increase his stock

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia believes in saying "try and try until you reach success".  Cecilia is 37 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. 

She has a retail store where she sells different products in the community.  Cecilia has had this business for 7 years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000.  Cecilia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods to sell to her customers.

In the future, Cecilia hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Upendo Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her late 20s is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a liquit soap business for one year now.  She works from 8am to 4pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge, which she wants to use to buy the materials needed for making more liquid soap for her sales.  Her dream is to one day start a business selling chicken.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Upendo Mloganzila" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more liquid soap.

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
