Lowella  is married with 5 school aged children.  Lowella  is 32 years old and lives in  Sagbayan Dangcagan Bukidnon.
 
Lowella  sells entertainment services offering video karaoke to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year.  Each month she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She  has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional units of video karaoke to generate additional income.
Lowella started being a member of HSPFI this year.  In the future, Lowella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional units of video karaoke for entertainment

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun, 36 years old, sells traditional cakes from her home.  She is a single mother with 4 children, 15, 13, 10, and 8 years old, three are studying in school and one more is helping her mother sell cakes. 

This family can make $9 per day for their income.  Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $15 on transportation.  She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her business selling cake.  If she could have a motorbike, then she would be able to sell cakes easier and be back home faster than before.  If she has the ability or can save more money, she would like to make more cake to sell to get more income so that she can send all of her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her cake selling business

loans.name: Oeum

texts.en: Mrs. Oeum has been earning a living by selling different kinds of vegetables, which she and her husband plant on their own farmland or buy from other local farmers in province of Siem Reap. They have given birth to six children; two of their children are employed while the remaining four go to school. Mrs. Oeum’s kids are concerned that they face difficulties in traveling to their workplace. They always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own motor vehicle. To solve the trouble, Mrs. Oeum has requested a loan in the amount of $1200 to be used to buy a new motorcycle for her kids to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her kids to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old married man and a father to four children. Mohamad has worked in transportation since 2008,when he came back to Lebanon from Sweden. Mohamad likes his business a lot; he is well known in the region. Mohamad is a man with a good reputation, and is devoted to his work and customers' needs. He is recommended by most of his clients, who are neighbors, relatives and foreigners.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance to his car, so he can be in a good situation for this summer's high season since tourists are his major source of living.

Mohamad hopes to stay satisfying to his customers' needs and in good health to be capable of doing all his family's requests.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his car.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam, 36 years old, is a fishe seller.  Her husband is a fisherman and their income is $16 per day. 

They have 4 children, three are studying in school and one is a construction worker who earns $4 per day for his income.  Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on school fees and $25 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy more fish to sell to other sellers so that she can make more income to support all of her children to attend school.

loans.use: To buy more fishes to sell to other sellers

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina, a 53-year-old married mother of six, lives in Kibawe, Bukidnon where for the past eight years she has been selling snacks, juices, canned goods, soap, etc. in her sari sari store to earn a living. Each month Rizalina earns PHP 5000, and she is now requesting a loan of 5000 to buy additional products to sell.

Rizalina became a member of HSPFI this year, and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell including snacks and canned goods.

loans.name: Ramuka Group

texts.fr:
Frédérique est une commerçante âgée de 44ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba dans la Province de Gitega du centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (tomates, poireaux) depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle est mariée à Timothée, un commerçant de planches. Ils ont ensemble  7 enfants  qui étudient et dont 4 a l’école secondaire. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
Son crédit de 320,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats de tomates et poireaux pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« RAMUKA».
texts.en:
Fréderique is a 44-year old vendor living in the village of Kibimba, in the Province of Gitega, in the centre of the country. She has been selling foodstuffs (tomatoes, leeks) for five years. She is also a farmer. She is married to Thimothée, a wood vendor. They have seven children, all of whom study, and four of whom are in secondary school. She herself has finished six years of elementary school.

Her loan of 320,000 Burundi francs will  bolster her capital and expand   her stock of tomatoes and leeks, heping her to increase her income.

She is a member of the “Ramuka” solidarity group.

loans.use: bolster her capital and  expand her stock of tomatoes and leeks, heping her to increase her income.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 48, a grocery seller, and her husband, a carpenter, earn a combined income of $14 per day. They have three children, all of them studying in school. Every month, Nary has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses.

Because all of her children are studying now and she hopes to send them to university, Nary needs to earn more income to support them and the other family expenses. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell and hopes to ultimately expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Cherel

texts.en: Cherel is 29 years old. She is married with three children. Cherel has a shop that sells rice, snacks, and some basic goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy additional rice to sell and additional goods, like snacks, canned goods, oil, vinegar, and more. Cherel became a member of HSPFI this year, 2011. In the future, Cherel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and other stock to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single young man. He is an ambitious hard-working man who wanted to have his own business and wants to depend on himself to build his future.

After getting training courses as a hair stylist and barber, Mohammad opened a small barber shop two years ago to start his own business. 

Now, two years after opening his shop, and after having a lot of regular customers, Mohammad wants to add a new service, skin cleaning, so he applied for this loan to buy a skin cleaning machine.

loans.use: To buy a skin cleaning machine.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 33 years old. She is a single lady with three children, ages 15, 13, and 10. She has been selling clothes for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to take care of her family.

She has applied for a loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the whole amount of her loan to purchase more clothing stock.

She plans to use the profit from her business to open up a boutique shop. In the future, she hopes to have a very big boutique in Mulolongo and to be selling imported clothes too.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Lezil

texts.en: Lezil is 22 years old. She is married with two infant children. Lezil has a shop that sells drinks, juices, and snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional goods, like snacks, biscuits, juices, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, and more. Lezil became a member of HSPFI this year, 2011. In the future, Lezil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old. He is married to Lydia, and they have one child who is 7. For seven years, Michael has been in the taxi-transport business in Githurai, Nairobi. He gets a monthly income of 21,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is applying for a loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD to service the car, buy spare parts, and get new tires. He plans to build his savings and buy another vehicle. This is his second loan from KADET LTD, after he paid his previous loan well and in good time. 

In the future, he plans to grow his business, build a home for his family, and own a fleet of vehicles in the transport industry.

loans.use: to service the car and buy new spare parts and tires

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg is 52 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia.They own  a small land plot with a house on it. Her daughter, Davaajargal, is 24 years old and she helps in her mother’s business.
 
Otgonchimeg’s husband runs a vehicle repairing business. Otgonchimeg is running a waste material collecting business. She collects waste materials such as cans, bones, copper, metal and plastics and sells them to waste recycling companies for a profit. She doesn’t have a special warehouse to store waste and uses her front yard as a collecting point. 

She has been doing this business for last five years and her working capital has reached 3,089,000 MNT. 

Otgonchimeg is planning to connect her house to centralized pure and sewage water line. Therefore she needs 1,600 USD to pay for the labor cost to the construction company for connecting her house to the line. She is going to repay her loan from her business profit.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost to the construction company for connecting her house to a centralized pure and waste water line.

loans.name: Fraternité Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bujiriri, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Fraternité»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de poissons (frais et fumés). Son mari est un bradeur des monnaies (échangeur de monnaie). Elle étale ses marchandises au marché sectoriel de Ndosho. Il y a 18 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  3 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 paniers de poissons.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Fraternité» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Bujiriri, representing the group "Fraternité," is a 33-year old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of 6 children, all of whom are students. She sells fish (fresh and smoked), and her husband is a currency exchanger. 

She displays her merchandise at the Ndosho local market. In business for 18 years, she has had 3 loan cycles with Hekima. With this new loan she will be able to buy 2 baskets of fish. Also, she plans to educate her children and buy a piece of land. This client is grateful to Hekima for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. For the most part, members of the group "Fraternité" are women.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca  is 38 years old and single. She owns a retail shop in Tala where by she sells things like cooking oil and sugar, and at the same time she does farming as her secondary business. She has been doing this business for the last 23 years and gets an income of  KES 18,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd, which she plans to buy more stock like cooking oil and sugar for sale, and seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the anticipated profits to increase her capital.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop some day. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock like cooking oil and sugar to sell, and seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Womens Group Buikwe

texts.en:
Rehema, 38, has been a retail business woman for the past decade in Lugazi. The happily married mother of six says she was encouraged into this business by her husband, who was in business himself. 

At her shop, she sells a variety of commodities such as rice, beans, millet, soap, cooking oil, etc. Previously she was a hawker. 

She says this business generates profits to the tune of  200,000 UGX monthly. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, bread, plastics, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Tunezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Jean-Marie est un commerçant âgé de 54ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba dans la Province de Gitega du centre du pays. Il  fait le commerce de la bière locale depuis 6ans. C’est un métier qu’il a commence alors qu’il était réparateur de vélos. Il est marié à Floride, une cultivatrice. Ils ont ensemble  9 enfants  dont 8 étudient avec 1a l’école secondaire. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.

Son crédit de 100,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de bière locale pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« TUNEZERWE».
texts.en:
Jean-Marie is a 54-year old vendor living in the village of Kibimba, in the Province of Gitega, in the centre of the country. He has been selling local beer for six years. He started this line of work after being a bicycle repairman. He is married to Floride,  a farmer. They have nine children, eight of whom study, and one is in secondary school. He finished six grades of elementary school.

His loan of 100,000 Burundi francs will allow him to bolster his capital and expand the sales volume of local beer, helping him increase his income.
He is a member of the “Tunezerwe” community group.

loans.use: to bolster his capital and expand the sales volume of local beer, helping him increase his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment and to plant a rice crop.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She’s married and her husband is an office worker.  They have 3 children between 12 and 18 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school.  Haja sells a range of goods, including lappa (traditional clothing), cold water and soft drinks.  Her mother gave her the money with which to start the business.

Her main challenge is the high level of competition. What she likes about this business is that it gives her the ability to support her children.  Haja has requested this loan to purchase more lappa. She wants to be a worthy woman and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional Cloth)

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 43 years old, is a firewood seller. Her husband is a guard.  Their income is $3 per day. They have 4 children, two of whom are studying and two of whom sell souvenirs at Angor Wat temple in Siemreap.   Their income is $9 per day.  Every month, Him has to spend around $70 for all the expenses of the family. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy farmland for doing farming. In the future, she wants to have a small store to sell groceries and firewood.  She will try harder to send her last two children to study so that they can get a good job in the future.

loans.use: To buy farmland to do farming

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 47 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 10 children.  Zosima works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

She has requested 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.  Zosima has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Zosima hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnuts and a carton of slippers.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima sells waakye (a classic Ghanaian rice and beans dish) at Abura. She serves the waakye with fried fish, chicken and eggs. She has received junior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her partner is a tailor. 

Alima has been in this trade for five years. She assists her husband in the education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy rice and beans to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant. In this picture she is seen frying the fish she uses to serve waakye.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Samouen

texts.en:
Samouen, 30 years old, works in a spa (massage place) in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.  Their income is $14 per day. They have 5 children, two of whom are studying.  The other three are at home. Every month, she has to spend about $95 on all the expenses of the family. 

Samouen would like a loan of $400 to buy clothes to sell, in addition to working in the spa, because the income is not enough to support her living expenses. She also plans to buy a Tuk Tuk ( a motorbike with a cart attached) for her husband to make more income.  She expects to send all of her children to study through secondary school at least.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Résidant à Avédji, (un quartier qui est situé à quelque kilomètres de la ville de Lomé). Mme Yawa est  âgée de 40ans, mariée à un cultivateur- éleveur, elle est mère de 03enfants. Elle se donne à cette activité depuis 2004 de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, 08 pièces de pagnes Deluxe  pour revendre  pour avoir de bénéfices, afin d’avoir  sa propre boutique pour éviter de marcher à chaque fois pour vendre et pour assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en: Resident of Avedji (a neighborhood situated a few kilometers from the city of Lome), Mrs. Yawa is 40 years old and married to a farmer-rancher. She is mother of 3 children.  She has been in business since 2004, selling from place to place.  She is asking for this second loan to buy 10 pieces of Hitarget pagne (traditional cloth) and 8 pieces of Deluxe pagne, for resale to earn a profit in order to have her own store so that she can avoid walking for each sale and to offer a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy pagne (traditional cloth).

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells tomatoes and smoked fish at Abura.  In the photo, she is standing in front of the oven she uses to smoke the fish. She is married and has four children. Her spouse is a cleaner. She supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: The photo above shows Aba's right hand on some fish which she has smoked. She is married and has seven children.  Her husband is a cleaner. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save towards buying land.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua cooks banku which is made from corn (maize) at Abura. She is married and has four children.  Her partner is into farming. She helps her partner in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize (corn) to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is into the production and sale of fante kenkey (foodstuff made from fermented maize dough) at Abura. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a security man. Rose has been selling kenkey for just two years. She wishes to increase her sales and so needs a loan from Kiva to buy additional bags of maize to use for the kenkey. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to use for fante kenkey.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has four children. She sells food items like rice, sugar and onions at Abura, which she has done for a year. As a single mother, having to take care of four children has not been easy. A loan will serve as an increase in her capital base so she can buy more bags of onions as customers are demanding larger quantities for sale. Ekua uses her income to see to the general upkeep of the home. Any increase in income as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of onions to meet customer need.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, aged 42, is married to Hannah.  They are blessed with three children, six, nine and eleven years old.  George has run a retail shop for 11 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.54,000.

This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD., and he has a very good credit history.  He will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, flour, soap and other items for resale.

George intends to use the expected profits to build his own shop and hopes to have a supermarket in future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (traditional cloth)

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drink, sweets for children, and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband has good skills for building stone and wooden houses. This couple has five children, one is single, four are married. Three of their children are employed in different occupations. Recently, Thou’s items for sale have been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to increase her stock inventory of soft drink, sweets, cooking supplies, etc. so she can continue selling.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of soft drink, sweets, cooking supplies, etc. so she can continue selling.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
H. is a 57-year-old married man, father of three children, living in Saida. H. has worked by trading in generators since 1990. He's well known in the region for selling good quality engines and providing the best customer service. He works hard to improve his business, which is very much requested in the region because of the electricity problems from which they suffer.
 
H. has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles. All of his loans were invested in his business as will be the case this time. His loan will increase the number of engines that he has so he can increase his capital and increase his income. His previous loans had a big impact on his business and on his family's social and financial situation. Most of his customers are businessmen and constructors, in addition to people who work hard at having electricity 24/7.

loans.use: to buy generators to increase his trade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair treatment, hair dryer, and hair chemicals

loans.name: Kossi Fofovi

texts.fr: Mr Kossi veut renforcer son activité (vente de ferrailles) qu’il a commencé en 2003 c’est pour cela il sollicite ce montant. Il achète à Lomé et revend dans un magasin. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi wants to strengthen his business (sale of scrap metal) that he started in 2003.  For this reason he is asking for this loan. He buys in Lome and resells in a store. His wife is a reseller.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is a 48-year-old, married man living in the village of Rizal West San Isidro. He is grateful because he is blessed with 3 children. 

According to Orlando, he is able to earn about 9,000 PHP per month as a driver working within his village. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for almost 4 years. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy new wheels and sprockets so that he can make his daily transport routine.

Orlando hopes that he could improve his family's standard way of living through the profits he generates from his motorcycle transport business. He also hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 28-year-old, single lady. Sally owns a cosmetics shop in Kisauni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last 3 years. 


Sally has been a KADET LTD client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of beauty products into her business. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan. Sally’s dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean, 21, is a homemaker. She stays at home to care for her two children and keeps to a daily routine as well. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a domestic fisherman along a river in Siem Reap Province. Recently, her husband hasn't been able to catch as many fish as before because a few of his fishing tools are broken. Therefore, Yean is applying for a loan for her husband so he can buy new fishing equipment to replace the old tools that are ruined.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment for her husband to replace the old tools that are ruined.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est revendeuse de cartes de recharges et divers. Elle est à son premier prêt et veut renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2008 et achète chez les distributeurs agréés.
texts.en: Adjowa retails phone recharge cards and various other items. She is on her first loan and wants to grow her business. She began it in 2008 and she buys from licensed distributors.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Hayitgul

texts.ru: Хайтгул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Её муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет торговую точку, где продает вафли, печенья, конфеты, жевательную резинку и многое другое. Кредит берет для покупки печенья,  конфет, шоколадов, соков и напитков. На полученную прибыль она хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Hayitgul lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 52 years old. She is married. She has two children. Her husband does construction work for hire. Hayitgul has secondary education and has been in retail for more than twelve years. She has a vendor location near her house where she sells waffles, cookies, candy, gum and other items. She is taking out the loan to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, juices and soft drinks. She will use the profit to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, chocolate, juices and soft drinks

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 44 years old married man living in the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. He is thankful because his only child has his own family already. Reynaldo would like to change his old sprocket and other motorcycle parts but due to insufficient funds he needs financial assistance, which is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.

According to him, he is able to earn about PHP 3,000 per month as motorcycle operator. Reynaldo has been in the business of transportation for 14 years. He hopes that the requested loan can help him maintain his business.

loans.use: to buy new sprockets and wheels for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase higher grade manure for use on his farms

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 43 years old, married to Zadok. Together they have three children. She has been running her dress making business for fourteen years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,000 which he uses to stock up in the business and also take care of her family.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 10,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more materials.

She plans to use the profit from her business to expand and educate her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for he dress making business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans, Afi est revendeuse de pagnes, sacs dame et des foulards. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend au même lieu. Elle a démarré en 2004 et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son activité. Son mari est conducteur et ils ont 02 enfants.
texts.en: 29 years old, Afi is a reseller of pagne (traditional cloth), women's purses, and scarves. She stocks up at the market in Lome and resells at the same place. She started in 2004 and is asking for this loan to strengthen her business.  Her husband is a chauffeur and they have 2 children.

loans.use: To buy pagne (traditional cloth), bags, and scarves.

loans.name: Lemomo

texts.en:
Lemomo is 36 years old, married with three children and resides in Narok Kenya. He had been a maize farmer for the past eight years. 

He learned about KADET LTD through a registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his third loan which he has plans to use to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.


He hopes to make profit and use to re-invest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru: Ольга проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Ее муж вместе с детьми находится в России. Сама Ольга предоставляет услугу. Она занимается шитьем национальных и других видов платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки. Она хочет открыть свое ателье.
texts.en: Olga lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband and children are now in Russia. Olga provides a service, she sews traditional and other types of dresses. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy a sewing machine. Olga wants to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 39-year-old married woman living in Ain with her husband. She opened a bakery to help her husband to cover their expenses and to improve their living conditions. Widad works hard to improve her business. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the third time, in order to buy flour and other necessary baking materials for the business.
 
Widad is a borrower of good standing. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends. She's honest and a woman who provides good customer service. She hopes to expand her business and to continue providing healthy living for her family. Widad operates her shop from her home; in that way she takes good care of both family and business at the same time.

loans.use: to buy flour and other necessary baking materials

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate because she sells her products in an open air market. Nadzua dreams of establishing a cattle business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Danniel

texts.en: Danniel is 29 years old, married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past five years and is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm supplies, including seeds and fertilizer, and additional livestock. He has been a good client and paid back his first loan completely and on-time. He hopes to use his profits to educate his children and expand his farm. He dreams of being a prosperous farmer and providing his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells rice porridge in the mornings at Elmina. She serves it with milk, bread and sugar. Mary has received senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer and she supports him to provide her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to acquire more rice, sugar, milk, etc. to make porridge for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits. In this photo, she has some loaves of bread in her hand.

loans.use: to acquire more rice, sugar, milk, etc. to make porridge for sale.

loans.name: Rohban Group

texts.en: Here we see the four members of a loan group known as Roban. They are small businesswomen who live and work in the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,600,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva in order to expand their businesses. Fatu leads the group. She is 38 years old, married to a building contractor and has four children, all of whom are in school. She makes a living by selling bowls, palm oil, cakes, soaps and other items. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years and is applying for this loan to buy more items in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bowls, palm oil, cakes, soaps and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora displays provisions such as biscuits, toffees, rice, etc. on a table for resale. She also sells yam tubers. Dora is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received senior high education. She has been in this trade for four years and as part of her duties she assists her husband to take care of the home. The reason why she wants a loan is to be able to buy more provisions to display for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to display for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a trader in clothes, slippers, socks, dresses, etc. at a village called Besease in Elmina which is a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a policeman. She has been through senior high school. Her business is four years old. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers, socks, dresses, etc. for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, socks and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en: Varduhi lives in Yerevan with her husband and two school-aged daughters. She graduated from teacher-training college and worked at a school for about 10 years. Seven years ago, she rented a shop where she creates flower arrangements and wedding baskets, and also sells wedding accessories. Thanks to a previous Kiva loan, Varduhi was also able to start renting evening dresses. Now she is applying for a new loan for $3,000 to buy new items to sell to her customers, including a perfumery.

loans.use: To buy a perfumery for her business.
